Edits and markup for user facing operations

- replace <programlisting> with screen and computeroutput
or userinput as needed

Change-Id: Icf44eda9dc6d87ac577baf211711c3f922ebe883
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/operations-guide refs/changes/78/75978/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
$ wget http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.3.1/cirros-0.3.1-x86_64-disk.img $ glance image-create --name='cirros image' --is-public=true --container-format=bare --disk-format=qcow2 < cirros-0.3.1-x86_64-disk.img $ glance help image-create $ glance details$ glance member-create <image-uuid> <project-uuid> $ glance image-delete <image uuid> $ glance help $ mysql> select glance.images.id, glance.images.name, keystone.tenant.name, is_public from glance.images inner join keystone.tenant on glance.images.owner=keystone.tenant.id; $ mysql> select name, value from image_properties where id = <image_id> $ nova flavor-list +----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+\+-------+-\+-------------++----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+\+-------+-\+-------------+ The nova flavor-create command allows authorized users to create new flavors. Additional flavor manipulation commands can be shown with the command: $ nova help | grep flavor
General Security Groups Configuration As noted in the previous chapter the number of rules per security group is controlled by the quota_security_group_rules and the number of allowed security groups per project is controlled by the quota_security_groups quota.
End User Configuration of Security Groups the Horizon Dashboard under "Access & Security". To see $ nova secgroup-list +---------+-------------++---------+-------------+ $ nova secgroup-list-rules open +-------------+-----------+---------+-----------+--------------++-------------+-----------+---------+-----------+--------------+ $ nova secgroup-create global_http "allow web traffic from the internet" +-------------+-------------------------------------++-------------+-------------------------------------+ $ nova secgroup-add-rule <secgroup> <ip-proto> <from-port> <to-port> <cidr> $ nova secgroup-add-rule global_http tcp 80 80 0.0.0.0/0 +-------------+-----------+---------+-----------+--------------++-------------+-----------+---------+-----------+--------------+ $ nova secgroup-add-rule global_http tcp 443 443 0.0.0.0/0 +-------------+-----------+---------+-----------+--------------++-------------+-----------+---------+-----------+--------------+ $ nova secgroup-list-rules global_http +-------------+-----------+---------+-----------+--------------++-------------+-----------+---------+-----------+--------------+ instances, you want to use SourceGroups. user specifies a SourceGroup (Security Group name) and then all the users' other Instances using the specified SourceGroup are selected dynamically. This dynamic selection alleviates the need for $ nova secgroup-add-group-rule cluster global-http tcp 22 22
$ cinder create --display-name test-volume 10 $ cinder list +------------+---------+--------------------+------+-------------+-------------++------------+---------+--------------------+------+-------------+-------------+ usage: cinder snapshot-create [--force <True|False>]Optional snapshot description. (Default=None) # grep 903b85d0-bacc-4855-a261-10843fc2d65b /var/log/cinder/*.log $ nova boot --flavor <flavor> --image <image> <name> $ nova delete <instance-uuid> $ nova show test-instance +------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------\+------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------\ $ nova keypair-add mykey > mykey.pem $ nova keypair-add --pub-key mykey.pub mykey $ nova boot --image ubuntu-cloudimage --flavor 2 --key_name mykey myimage $ nova boot --image=test-image --flavor=1 --meta description='Small test image' smallimage $ nova show smallimage +------------------------+-----------------------------------------++------------------------+-----------------------------------------+ $ nova boot --image ubuntu-cloudimage --flavor 1 --user-data mydata.file $ nova boot --image ubuntu-cloudimage --flavor 1 --file /root/.ssh/authorized_keys=special_authorized_keysfile $ nova add-secgroup <server> <securitygroup> $ nova remove-secgroup <server> <securitygroup> $ nova floating-ip-create $ nova add-floating-ip <server> <address> $ nova remove-floating-ip <server> <address> $ nova volume-attach <server> <volume> <device> --block-device-mapping <dev-name=mapping> $ nova boot --image 4042220e-4f5e-4398-9054-39fbd75a5dd7 --flavor 2 --key-name mykey --block-device-mapping vdc=13:::0 boot-with-vol-test $ nova boot --flavor 2 --key-name mykey --block-device-mapping vda=13:::0 boot-from-vol-test The OpenStack snapshot mechanism allows you to create new $ nova image-create <instance name or uuid> <name of new image> # sync # apt-get install util-linux # fsfreeze -f /mnt $ nova image-create mon-instance mon-snapshot # fsfreeze -u /mnt # fsfreeze -f / && sleep 30 && fsfreeze -u / some of the most useful of many OpenStack commands. For We hope your users remain happy and recognise your hard work! (For more hard work, turn the page to the next chapter where we discuss the system-facing operations: Maintenance, Failures and Debugging.)

commit_message:
Correcting show/hide functionality for node group templates

Fixing the behavior of the search box and how it works with
the show/hide all configs link.  Now, when the search box
is blanked out, we check the state of whether or not we
are showing all configs or just "important" ones and display
configs according to that.

Closes-Bug: #1212285

Change-Id: Id74cf3adfbc78a3f1983e32108c78eb03eef4bdf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard refs/changes/72/76972/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ($("a.full-config-show")[0].style.display == "inline") { hide_not_important_fields(this); }

commit_message:
Fix a bug with empty context

Problemo: Exception thrown if empty context is passed
Fix: Make sure context key is not created if context variable is None
Unit test added.
Closes-Bug: #1286373
Change-Id: I8ab5691fd34ab98c6fd99fbd35281b5179bb0dd5

commit_message:
[IDH] Added IDH 3.0.2 support

This is initial support of 3.0.2 version.
Supported features:
* all applicable functionality of 2.5.1
* YARN start
* EDP

TODO (will be covered separately):
* Code cleanup (bug #1285966)
* Extended validation
* Integration tests
* More unit tests

Implements: blueprint idh-support-3.0.2

Change-Id: Ic9f3c54c2b28cc7c0bf12db4c9bacc42e313365f

commit_message:
Re-enable file-based locking behavior

There are places in Nova (at least) that require file-based locking
behavior for locking on shared filesystems.  These situations can
be recognized because those calls to synchronized specify a
lock_path, so when that happens we need to return a file-based lock
instead of a posix lock.

Change-Id: I21dd17d58d1c321566c72e808a055a0bd625c647
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/97/77297/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import errnoclass BrokenLock(lockutils._FileLock): def __init__(self, name, errno_code): super(BrokenLock, self).__init__(name) self.errno_code = errno_code def unlock(self): pass def trylock(self): err = IOError() err.errno = self.errno_code raise err class FileBasedLockingTestCase(test.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(FileBasedLockingTestCase, self).setUp() self.lock_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp() def test_lock_file_exists(self): lock_file = os.path.join(self.lock_dir, 'lock-file') @lockutils.synchronized('lock-file', external=True, lock_path=self.lock_dir) def foo(): self.assertTrue(os.path.exists(lock_file)) foo() def test_bad_acquire(self): lock_file = os.path.join(self.lock_dir, 'lock') lock = BrokenLock(lock_file, errno.EBUSY) self.assertRaises(threading.ThreadError, lock.acquire) def test_no_lock_path(self): lock_file = os.path.join(self.lock_dir, 'should-not-exist') @lockutils.synchronized('should-not-exist', external=True) def foo(): # Without lock_path explicitly passed to synchronized, we should # default to using posix locks and not create a lock file. self.assertFalse(os.path.exists(lock_file)) foo()
deleted_lines: def test_synchronized_externally_without_lock_path(self): self.config(lock_path=None) @lockutils.synchronized('external', 'test-', external=True) def foo(): pass self.assertRaises(cfg.RequiredOptError, foo)

commit_message:
Fix upper bound checking for flavor create parameters

Fix flavor-create upper bound checking so it uses platform-independent
32-bit max signed integer value instead of sys.maxint, which causes
problems on 64-bit platforms.  The DB int type is a 32-bit signed
integer, regardless of platform.

Change-Id: I82624121a45f6385d3ea9ae9c032109834584fac
Closes-bug: 1278939

Add support for minimal MongoDB testing

This commit adds scripts for creating MongoDB image
and defines group of tests to check MongoDB instance
creation

Implements: blueprint base-mongodb-image

commit_message:
Fixed Horizon SSL issues

Apache fails to start when the SSLEngine directive is turned
on outside of a vhost. Horizon configuration has been turned
into two apache vhosts. When SSL is enabled it will create
the second vhost for SSL. Additionally ssl_redirect was added
to have a redirect from http to https.

Closes-Bug: #1246742
Change-Id: Icf2a4bed8980137181810f2f5d3a38db54af4443

revisions:

Nova fails to start on Windows due to non portable signal handling
(SIGUSR1) employed in this patch.

This patch enables the reporting feature only if signal is available

Change-Id: I579408dddfa18317f4a31eb7d9726bc641eaec04
Closes-Bug: #1286528
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Guru Meditation portability issue

Nova fails to start on Windows due to non portable signal handling
(SIGUSR1) employed in this patch.

This patch enables the reporting feature only if signal is available
on the current platform.

Change-Id: I579408dddfa18317f4a31eb7d9726bc641eaec04
Closes-Bug: #1286528
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/96/77596/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def setup_autorun(cls, version, signum=None): if not signum and hasattr(signal, 'SIGUSR1'): # SIGUSR1 is not supported on all platforms signum = signal.SIGUSR1 if signum: signal.signal(signum, lambda *args: cls.handle_signal(version, *args))
deleted_lines: def setup_autorun(cls, version, signum=signal.SIGUSR1): signal.signal(signum, lambda *args: cls.handle_signal(version, *args))

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-20 23:13:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5057a531dba9a8d053f303032f2c18e235a5302f', 'message': 'Remove and recreate interface if already exists

If a nova-compute machine restarts when openvswitch comes up it logs the
following warning messages for all tap interfaces that do not exist:

bridge|WARN|could not open network device tap2cf7dbad-9d (No such device)

Once the compute-node starts it recreates the interfaces and re-adds them
to the ovs-bridge. Unfortunately, ovs does not reinitialize the interfaces
as they are already in ovsdb and does not assign them a ofport number.

This situation corrects itself though the next time a port is added to the
ovs-bridge which is why no one has probably noticed this issue till now.

In order to correct this we should first remove interface that exist and
then readd them.

Change-Id: I1dc01604c5857941d9f35eb1e0c4d5103a56d57b
Closes-bug: #1270973
Related-bug: #1268762

commit_message:
Remove and recreate interface if already exists

If a nova-compute machine restarts when openvswitch comes up it logs the
following warning messages for all tap interfaces that do not exist:

bridge|WARN|could not open network device tap2cf7dbad-9d (No such device)

Once the compute-node starts it recreates the interfaces and re-adds them
to the ovs-bridge. Unfortunately, ovs does not reinitialize the interfaces
as they are already in ovsdb and does not assign them a ofport number.

This situation corrects itself though the next time a port is added to the
ovs-bridge which is why no one has probably noticed this issue till now.

In order to correct this we should first remove interface that exist and
then readd them.

Change-Id: I1dc01604c5857941d9f35eb1e0c4d5103a56d57b
Closes-bug: #1270973
Related-bug: #1268762

commit_message:
Replaced calls of get(foo, None) -> get(foo)

If no default value is specified, the get method of dictionaries
defaults to 'None' already.
So removing the 'None' argument to make the code more clean and
readable.

Change-Id: I2f29315488d515aa2837d06ea59ab41e8ca05fc8

commit_message:
Expand node-group-template usage validation msg

Now that we have a CLI, the error messages returned from validation
are presented directly to the user. Currently, node group templates
cannot be deleted if they are in use. This change expands the error
message to tell the user where the node group templates are in use.

Change-Id: I3764aa6730db52f2a313626054c941eb3a9723bc

commit_message:
Revert upgrading of cinder-rootwrap config

Commit 388c5382cfa099a4bfb096ce66f9473f76a86f48 added the refresh of
cinder-rootwrap config on upgrade from havana to icehouse.

However, the final model used for migration to oslo.rootwrap is seamless
and does not require changes in cinder configuration, so this is
actually useless.

Change-Id: I4a629ba3b83f2518b5033899c5aa1180be471e34

commit_message:
Add project to unscoped stack list response

For an unscoped stack list, stacks will possibly belong to several
different projects.  As a user who can see all stacks, it is useful to
be able to distinguish which stacks belong to which projects.

Co-Authored-By: Anderson Mesquita <andersonvom@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I4148a298ef7a41b815b477c49ff4aaf331845129
Implements: blueprint management-api
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/89/72789/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return stacks_view.collection(req, stacks=stacks, count=count, tenant_safe=tenant_safe)

blueprint.  A user allowed by the policy stacks:global_index will be

commit_message:
Unscoped List Stacks

This allows non tenant-scoped list of stacks for the management api
blueprint. A user allowed by the policy stacks:global_index will be
able to make a call to "/:tenant_id/stacks?global_tenant=true" and get
all stacks in Heat, and not just the ones owned by the user,
effectively bypassing tenant scoping.

If the user is not authorized by the policy and they pass the
global_tenant param, the request will get denied by the policy enforcer
and 403 Forbidden is returned.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint management-api
Change-Id: I973a7ad2726eb6d9c972d08abe15e241aa120ec3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/41/63041/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if cnxt.is_admin: stacks = db_api.stack_get_all(cnxt, limit, sort_keys, marker, sort_dir, filters) or [] else: stacks = db_api.stack_get_all_by_tenant(cnxt, limit, sort_keys, marker, sort_dir, filters) or []
deleted_lines: stacks = db_api.stack_get_all_by_tenant(cnxt, limit, sort_keys, marker, sort_dir, filters) or []

subject: Alter stack_count_all_by_tenant to stack_count_all
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-03 21:48:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/29628e994a8c932577ef088de1353b4d65d007a6', 'message': 'Alter stack_count_all_by_tenant to stack_count_all

Preparing the database for the unscoped list stacks, this removes
stack_count_all_by_tenant in favor of a single function that is tenant
aware.  This way, you can call stack_count_all(tenant_safe=False) and
count all stacks, regardless of the tenants.

tenant_safe defaults to True.

Implements: blueprint management-api (partial)
Change-Id: Ic44b884120290b6ceaf4936e015ef6661aaf6694
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-04 13:38:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/43708c467d0830ba045be1d90386882c5a48f34e', 'message': 'Alter stack_count_all_by_tenant to stack_count_all

Preparing the database for the unscoped list stacks, this removes
stack_count_all_by_tenant in favor of a single function that is tenant
aware.  This way, you can call stack_count_all(tenant_safe=False) and

commit_message:
Alter stack_count_all_by_tenant to stack_count_all

Preparing the database for the unscoped list stacks, this removes
stack_count_all_by_tenant in favor of a single function that is tenant
aware.  This way, you can call stack_count_all(tenant_safe=False) and
count all stacks, regardless of the tenants.

tenant_safe defaults to True.

Co-Authored-By: Anderson Mesquita <andersonvom@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint management-api (partial)
Change-Id: Ic44b884120290b6ceaf4936e015ef6661aaf6694

commit_message:
Fix stack_get_all call on stack watcher

This reverts the Engine.start() behavior to what it was before the patch
Ifdcfc44a3483a089ae803cfd044151262957674a.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1285681
Change-Id: I47891c41fd345fe614675aeb9f82ff5d74d50a76

commit_message:
Change Resource timestamps to save correct info

Resource.updated_time is currently being treated as modification time
of the object in the database.  Since it's not a very useful thing to
have and the CFN API treats this value as "the last time an update
call was issued", it makes sense to have the same behavior here as
well.

This changes the current real-time retrieval of created_time and
updated_time in favor of the attributes already present in the
resource and changes the information stored in these two fields to be
the time the resource was created and the time the resource was last
updated by the user, respectively.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Related-Bug: #1193269
Change-Id: Iad689b97d237fa63856b878827a1fcb1676c991c

deleted_lines: tmpl = {'Type': 'Foo'} res = generic_rsrc.GenericResource('test_res_upd', tmpl, self.stack) res.state_set(res.CREATE, res.IN_PROGRESS, 'testing')

Add Hadoop 2 vanilla plugin

* deploy services: namenode, datanode, resourcemanager, nodemanager
* provisioning configs

Partially implements blueprint: vanilla-plugin-hadoop-2

commit_message:
Change software_config storage of config and io columns

Previously the config column was of type LongText and all config
scripts were expected to be strings. However there will be many
config formats which are best stored and returned as parsed data
structures (tripleo metadata, cfn-init, ansible, salt).

This change converts the software_config config column to Json
and deletes the io column. The config, inputs, outputs and options
are now stored in the config Json column as top-level dict entries.

No data conversion is needed for this migration since nobody is
using software-config in the wild yet.

partial blueprint hot-software-config-rest

Change-Id: I03dc528bc2a6b255d6baa0eb8b9c1c8a7e6f872c

commit_message:
Add admin_pass as a property

This allows users to add the admin password as one of the template's
parameters so that nova servers are created using it.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint custom-adminpass (partial)
Change-Id: I800601f95682ad23ce2e34c7168aec7ada8e03a5

commit_message:
Fixes get configuration defaults

Querying for the default configuration of an instance fails when
the my.cnf has keys with no values. ie 'skip-external-locking'.
To fix this, we modify the config template to include values

Change-Id: Iab96ec8cd3f8d79fe2b3946c4e9db094a3acbe93
Closes-Bug: 1285428

commit_message:
Add validation of nested property schema

Existing property schema can find Unknown proprties during validation
process only for not nested properties. This patch adds validation
for nested properties.

Closes-bug: #1283243
Change-Id: Ie3942fee5be82adbffa4919496c70590bb4e2a6c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/12/75512/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for key in properties.data: if key not in schemata: msg = _("Unknown Property %s") % key raise exception.StackValidationFailed(message=msg) # little hack for creating more readable message er_msg = str(e) if "Unknown Property" in er_msg: list_str = er_msg.split(' ', 2) list_str.pop(1) er_msg = ' '.join(list_str) msg = _("Property error : %s") % er_msg

commit_message:
Initial support for single instance Couchbase

This code adds the ability to create single instance couchbase server.
No other operations supported.

Change-Id: Icaac84c64f89b07ed2e85ad5215809d04ae74ebc
Implements: blueprint couchbase-single-instance-ga

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-25 04:04:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/f7da34c13c489368feb2da4d645af51f8522be70', 'message': "Parameterize cpu_mode, deprecatelibvirt_type

The libvirt cpu_mode setting in nova.conf currently isn't exposed
via the compute::libvirt class, but can be very useful in nested
virtualization situations (as are common in development labs).
The nova default value for the cpu_type parameter if left unspecified
is dependent on the value of the virt_type parameter, and both
the virt_type and cpu_mode parameters exist within the [libvirt]
section of nova.conf.

This patch adds a parameter allowing users to set cpu_type.
In order to set the default value for cpu_type correctly, this
patch also deprecates the libvirt_type parameter (which
added a 'libvirt_type' parameter to the 'DEFAULT' section of
nova.conf) in favor of virt_type (which sets a 'virt_type'
parameter in the 'libvirt' section of nova.conf).  The latter
change is required due to a change in the config file format
in Icehouse which sets libvirt-specific parameters in their
own section of the file rather than including them in the
DEFAULT section.

Rspec tests have been updated accordingly.

Change-Id: I0136f15621f616787aba1bbcbf68208bc8f9a1b1

commit_message:
Parameterize cpu_mode

The libvirt cpu_mode setting in nova.conf currently isn't exposed
via the compute::libvirt class, but can be very useful in nested
virtualization situations (as are common in development labs).
The nova default value for the cpu_type parameter if left unspecified
is dependent on the value of the virt_type setting, and both
the virt_type and cpu_mode settings exist within the [libvirt]
section of nova.conf.  This patch adds a parameter allowing users
to set cpu_type with appropriate defaults based on the value
of the libvirt_virt_type parameter.

Change-Id: I0136f15621f616787aba1bbcbf68208bc8f9a1b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/48/75748/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*libvirt_cpu_mode*] # (optional) The libvirt CPU mode to configure. Possible values # include custom, host-model, and host-passthrough. Setting to # false leaves out the libvirt_cpu_mode configuration line. # Defaults to false # $migration_support = false, $livirt_cpu_mode = false if $libvirt_cpu_mode { nova_config { 'DEFAULT/libvirt_cpu_mode': value => $libvirt_cpu_mode; } }

commit_message:
Add nova-objectstore bind address

This patch provides an additional parameter
that allows the user to specify a bind address
for the objectstore service.

Change-Id: Ib6d3ba0edd7d0b554231d6db1125e963843c9795

commit_message:
Add support for multiple NetApp backends

This change adds a new define for cinder::backend::netapp, allowing
users to create multiple NetApp backend definitions within their puppet
manifests for use with Cinder.

Change-Id: Ia32fd18e399d3bb4b46021d452a8384a1a8efe18
Implements: blueprint cinder-multi-backend-netapp
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/02/77202/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'cinder::backend::netapp' do let(:title) {'hippo'} let :params do { :volume_backend_name => 'netapp-cdot-nfs', :netapp_login => 'netapp', :netapp_password => 'password', :netapp_server_hostname => '127.0.0.2', } end let :default_params do { :netapp_server_port => '80', :netapp_size_multiplier => '1.2', :netapp_storage_family => 'ontap_cluster', :netapp_storage_protocol => 'nfs', :netapp_transport_type => 'http', :netapp_vfiler => '', :netapp_volume_list => '', :netapp_vserver => '', :expiry_thres_minutes => '720', :thres_avl_size_perc_start => '20', :thres_avl_size_perc_stop => '60', :nfs_shares_config => '/etc/cinder/nfs_shares', } end shared_examples_for 'netapp volume driver' do let :params_hash do default_params.merge(params) end it 'configures netapp volume driver' do should contain_cinder_config("#{params_hash[:volume_backend_name]}/volume_driver").with_value( 'cinder.volume.drivers.netapp.common.NetAppDriver') params_hash.each_pair do |config,value| should contain_cinder_config("#{params_hash[:volume_backend_name]}/#{config}").with_value( value ) end end it 'marks netapp_password as secret' do should contain_cinder_config("#{params_hash[:volume_backend_name]}/netapp_password").with_secret( true ) end end context 'with default parameters' do before do params = {} end it_configures 'netapp volume driver' end context 'with provided parameters' do it_configures 'netapp volume driver' end end

*) Mova benchmark.base to benchmark.scenarios.base
*) Add context.base module that we will use in future
   for auto discovering, config validation & logging of
   context

This is the base step that is required before starting work around
task config refactoring & moving config validation to: context,

bp benchmark-engine-refactoring

Change-Id: Icf9974947de34a9273cd2dc9f2f44b3ce563c8fe
'}]
commit_message:
Fix and unify structure of modules in benchmark engine

*) Move benchmark.runner to benchmark.runners.base
*) Mova benchmark.base to benchmark.scenarios.base
*) Add context.base module that we will use in future
   for auto discovering, config validation & logging of
   context

This is the base step that is required before starting work around
task config refactoring & moving config validation to: context,
runner, and scenario base classes from benchmark.engine

bp benchmark-engine-refactoring

Change-Id: Icf9974947de34a9273cd2dc9f2f44b3ce563c8fe

more clear messages in case of failure.

log stdout and stderr in addition to the return code

Usually there is more useful information in stdout/stderr than the
result code.

commit_message:
Use six.moves.xmlrpc_client instead of xmlrpclib

Implement jaypipes' note about this, to improve Python 2/3 compatibility.

Change-Id: I89d27045142dd46ed8d91871ce3681ea9032cfe3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/57/76857/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six.moves.xmlrpc_client as xmlrpclib
deleted_lines: try: import xmlrpclib except ImportError: # NOTE(jaypipes): xmlrpclib was renamed to xmlrpc.client in Python3 # however the function and object call signatures # remained the same. This whole try/except block should # be removed and replaced with a call to six.moves once # six 1.4.2 is released. See http://bit.ly/1bqrVzu import xmlrpc.client as xmlrpclib

commit_message:
Add docs on pNFS support in Cinder NFS drivers

This change adds the documentation for the changes made in Brick to
use NFS v4.1 and parallel NFS (pNFS), that will be used by Cinder
when mounting NFS shares using the base NFS driver (or potentially
other drivers that are derived from the base driver).

Change-Id: I4932c0f43714288ebbb43911258d2c0a4c41972c
Implements: blueprint pnfs
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/08/76208/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <note> <para>As of the Icehouse release, the NFS driver (and other drivers based off of it) will attempt to mount shares using version 4.1 of the NFS protocol (including pNFS). If the mount attempt is unsuccessful (due to a lack of client or server support), a subsquent mount attempt that requests the default behavior of the <literal>mount.nfs</literal> command (which on most distributions is to attempt NFS v4.0, then silently fallback to NFS v3.0) will be performed. If the <literal>nfs_mount_options</literal> configuration option contains a request for a specific version of NFS to be utilized, the mount will be attempted as requested with no subsequent attempts.</para> </note> <tip> <para> The various benefits of NFS v4.1 and pNFS can also be leveraged by the Nova compute nodes by requesting that NFS v4.1 be used by libvirt when mounting NFS shares. This can be achieved by specifying the <literal>nfs_mount_options</literal> configuration option in <literal>nova.conf</literal>. See the <link linkend="ch_configuring-openstack-compute">Compute</link> section for more information. </para> </tip>

commit_message:
Adding/Handling DB specific exceptions

Added a new family of exceptions to easily differentiate the exceptions
related to database API.
Modified the way in wich exceptions are handled by the API, in order to
obfuscate the DB exceptions presented to the user.

Change-Id: Ic910549bd205eb4c2069dc5fdf2905e4ead21ffb
Closes-Bug: #1237293

commit_message:
Sync common db code from Oslo

This sync contains commit ``ce69e7f Don't store engine instances in oslo.db ``
which removed global engine from oslo.db code. So, added code
for work with sqla engines and sessions to Glance - get_engine()
and get_session() functions in glance.db.sqlalchemy.api module.

Also this remove database slave connection and tpool features, because
they was removed from oslo code and seeps to be unused in Glance.

Full list of changes:

7959826 db: move all options into database group
dda24eb Introduce mysql_sql_mode option, remove old warning
0b5af67 Introduce a method to set any MySQL session SQL mode
8dccc7b Handle ibm_db_sa DBDuplicateEntry integrity errors
0f24d82 Fix migration.db_version when no tables
ac84a40 Update log translation domains
c0d357b Add model_query() to db.sqlalchemy.utils module
84254fc Fix a small typo in api.py
b8a676c Remove CONF.database.connection default value
86707cd Remove None for dict.get()
0545121 Fix duplicating of SQL queries in logs
fcf517d Update oslo log messages with translation domains
fa05b7c Restore the ability to load the DB backend lazily
630d395 Don't use cfg.CONF in oslo.db
ce69e7f Don't store engine instances in oslo.db
35dc1d7 py3kcompat: remove
b4f72b2 Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors
271adfb Format sql in db.sqlalchemy.session docstring
0334cb3 Handle exception messages with six.text_type
eff69ce Drop dependency on log from oslo db code
7a11a04 Automatic retry db.api query if db connection lost
11f2add Clean up docstring in db.sqlalchemy.session
1b5147f Only enable MySQL TRADITIONAL mode if we're running against MySQL
39e1c5c Move db tests base.py to common code
986dafd Fix parsing of UC errors in sqlite 3.7.16+/3.8.2+
9a203e6 Use dialect rather than a particular DB API driver
1779029 Move helper DB functions to db.sqlalchemy.utils

commit_message:
Use image from the api in run_instance, if present

When booting an instance, the API layer already fetches the image
from glance and passes it to the compute manager. Right now, that
info is ignored and the compute node has fetches the image metadata
again from glance if booting from an image. This is a problem when
booting from a volume, because most of the properties that the volume
keeps when it has been created from an image won't be considered.

With this patch, the image metadata passed to run_instance from the API
will be used if present instead of asking glance again.

Change-Id: I4680d9d309d7a09f64d52ef0fb105282ace79e5f
Closes-Bug: 1281973

commit_message:
Fix Redis After Configuration Group Merge

the configuration-group implementation forgot to update the
prepare() method for redis to include overrides. in addition, an
override.config.template is now required to avoid a fatal error in
the taskmanager.

Change-Id: If12a4e4c9f1bbb8e96a3ed443756f70398525bde
Closes-Bug: #1277390

commit_message:
Sort requirement files in alphabetical order

This makes code more readable, and can check whether specific library
in the requirement files easily. We also enforce the check in pep8.

Closes-Bug: #1285478
Change-Id: I35da134f7224cef4a862bdb6f73fa2ec21498775

to their logs.  This patch adds the same feature to the
Openvswitch agent.

commit_message:
libvirt: handle exception while get vcpu info

If an exception is raised while get a libvirt domain's vcpu info,
the update_available_resource periodic task will be failed, which
will result in the resource of this compute node will never be
reported.

This patch add an exception handling to avoid this situation.
Closes-bug: #1270008

Change-Id: I69109402416989fdaa421f8dbc72953bd067c407
(cherry picked from commit 844df860c38ac38550b8d1739fd53131cd7fd864)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/29/72129/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: vcpus = dom.vcpus() if vcpus is None: LOG.debug(_("couldn't obtain the vpu count from domain id:" " %s") % dom_id)

commit_message:
Implement OpenFlow Agent mechanism driver

This adds ML2 mechanism driver controlling OpenFlow switches
and an agent using Ryu as OpenFlow Python library.
- An agent acts as an OpenFlow controller on each compute nodes.
- OpenFlow 1.3 (vendor agnostic unlike OVS extensions).

Implements: blueprint ryu-ml2-driver
Change-Id: I6a8168d24f911996639179d91c4da49151751057

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 OpenStack Foundation. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import mock def patch_fake_ryu_of(): ryu_mod = mock.Mock() ryu_base_mod = ryu_mod.base ryu_lib_mod = ryu_mod.lib ryu_lib_hub = ryu_lib_mod.hub ryu_ofproto_mod = ryu_mod.ofproto ryu_ofproto_of13 = ryu_ofproto_mod.ofproto_v1_3 ryu_ofproto_of13.OFPTT_ALL = 0xff ryu_ofproto_of13.OFPG_ANY = 0xffffffff ryu_ofproto_of13.OFPP_ANY = 0xffffffff ryu_ofproto_of13.OFPFC_ADD = 0 ryu_ofproto_of13.OFPFC_DELETE = 3 ryu_app_mod = ryu_mod.app ryu_app_ofctl_mod = ryu_app_mod.ofctl ryu_ofctl_api = ryu_app_ofctl_mod.api return mock.patch.dict('sys.modules', {'ryu': ryu_mod, 'ryu.base': ryu_base_mod, 'ryu.lib': ryu_lib_mod, 'ryu.lib.hub': ryu_lib_hub, 'ryu.ofproto': ryu_ofproto_mod, 'ryu.ofproto.ofproto_v1_3': ryu_ofproto_of13, 'ryu.app': ryu_app_mod, 'ryu.app.ofctl': ryu_app_ofctl_mod, 'ryu.app.ofctl.api': ryu_ofctl_api})

commit_message:
Revert "Stop devtest if user was not in libvirtd group"

This reverts commit 3690dcb9933c13dac6cc680dcb13f0db107d63ad.

The prior behaviour does work on Ubuntu and was crucial for CI to
work. This commit broke CI and should not have been merged.

Change-Id: I6a333820d495e8337931ba5cc663aeaafda7fb53
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/06/77506/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exec sudo su -l $USER -c "PATH=$PATH $0" echo "Check to see that you are in the $LIBVIRTD_GROUP group in your current shell before going on. You can check by running:" echo echo "id | grep $LIBVIRTD_GROUP" echo echo "If you are not, it's because this script added you. You can pick up the group by logging out and back in, or run:" echo echo "sudo su -l $USER"
deleted_lines: echo "$USER was just added the the $LIBVIRTD_GROUP. Devtest will not" echo "be able to continue until you start a new session to pick up the" echo "new group membership. This can be done by either logging out and" echo "back in, or running:" echo echo "sudo su -l $USER" echo echo "To verify that your group membership is correct, you can use the" echo "following command:" echo echo "id | grep $LIBVIRTD_GROUP" echo echo "Once you have verified your group membership, you should be able to" echo "re-run devtest and continue successfully." # We have to exit non-zero so the calling script knows to stop. exit 1

commit_message:
Add support for single instance Couchbase

Add scripts for creating Couchbase image and groups of tests to
check Couchbase single instance creation.

Change-Id: I97ac6ebdbe6cdd0f13e07e0c4ed644cf0033295a
Implements: blueprint couchbase-single-instance-diskimage

commit_message:
Openvswitch update_port should return updated port info

Found when I enabled test_extension_allowedaddress_pairs, where
test_create_port_removed_allowed_address_pairs would fail due to the
returned port still containing the original addresspair.  The cause is
ovs simply not updating the port info being returned.

This patch additionally enables test_extension_allowedaddress_pairs for
openvswitch.

Moved checks and updating into method similar to what we do for
extradhcpopts and security_groups.

Additionally, this required fixing is_address_pairs_attribute_updated() as
it was passing (non-hashable) dicts to utils.compare_elements.

Change-Id: Ic871fea68fb9fcc862b1fd5ae5fe7aec540e4a30
Partial-Bug: #1255150

commit_message:
BigSwitch: Allow concurrent backend REST calls

Allow configurable maximum number of concurrent
backend REST calls in the BigSwitch/restproxy
plugin.

Implements: blueprint bsn-concurrent-rest
Change-Id: I70ec8105cf7983182224a7cde79a2174c098275e

commit_message:
Add markdown to requirements

We are using this library to parse markdown README files for embedded
components which need to be tested in TripleO. Specifically we are using
it in tripleo-image-elements for this purpose.

It is licensed with a 3-clause BSD license and is well maintained.

Change-Id: I864ac4783f8eb0d86f2452837c9ecb4753bbadd4

commit_message:
Adding sqlalchemy db2 dialect dependencies

Need to add DB2 dependency for new db2 disconnect listener
that uses the dialect to determine if sql errors are
disconnect errors instead of hardcoding dielect specific
error codes and messages

pypi homepage: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/ibm_db_sa

There is a python3 package: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/ibm-db-sa-py3

This is the code repo:

https://code.google.com/p/ibm-db/source/checkout?repo=ibm-db-sa

Related-Bug: #1231657

Change-Id: I7f91ab1978399f6dcabc76c939be54746db14620

commit_message:
Remove redundant default value None for dict.get

The default value for dict.get is None, no need to specify again.

Change-Id: I16936362d0373d7b0b06d908ab21407b07a21c16

commit_message:
Extend servers core to list port ids in os-networks v3

Nova shouldn't proxy any network stuff. Instead of showing
network info, just extend server to show port
list. The output is as below:
json:
{'server': {
  ...
   {'os-networks:ports':
     [{'id': 'aaaaaaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaa-aaaaaaaaaaaa'},
      {'id': 'bbbbbbbb-bbbb-bbbb-bbbb-bbbbbbbbbbbb'}]}
 }
}

Partially implements bp v3-api-core
DocImpact

Change-Id: I9250d33bdd8856d21c7bb6a9145ee634fdb72b18

commit_message:
Change default img_dir for scenario test

Qcow2 img support was introduced in
  Change-Id: I4c812176ed1800052c3192110067b1ae7fb04b85 .
But we can't still use it in the gate because the devstack expects the
downloaded image file path is $TOP_DIR/files not $TOP_DIR/files/images.
So this commit changes the default qcow2 image file path to it.

Change-Id: I406af5078bc3a710c662f2997e2fca156effbf76

commit_message:
Disable auto allocate network for v3 api

The v3 api won't proxy any neutron api call. It only accepts the port id
as parameter when creating a instance. So it also won't allocate network
port automaticlly for new instance. This patch adds paramenter
auto_allocate_network to distinguish v2 and v3 api. v3 won't allocate
network automatically. v2 will keep some behavior as before.

Partially implements bp v3-api-core
DocImpact

Change-Id: Id40518df85a0ff37ad1095032557cc95a9d183b5

commit_message:
Modify error decription in cleanup_ports

the method _cleanup_ports should not be removed, and the patch is already
merged, but the description should be modified.

Change-Id: I9c70146ce4da099aff82ad3fb810c1a49276a71b
Closes-bug: #1280980
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/54/73954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def _cleanup_ports(self, network_id): # TODO(mlavalle) This method will be removed once patch # https://review.openstack.org/#/c/46563/ merges in Neutron if not self.ports: if self.tempest_client: resp, resp_body = self.network_admin_client.list_ports() else: resp_body = self.network_admin_client.list_ports() self.ports = resp_body['ports'] ports_to_delete = [ port for port in self.ports if (port['network_id'] == network_id and port['device_owner'] != 'network:router_interface') ] for port in ports_to_delete: try: LOG.info('Cleaning up port id %s, name %s' % (port['id'], port['name'])) self.network_admin_client.delete_port(port['id']) except exceptions.NotFound: LOG.warn('Port id: %s, name %s not found for clean-up' % (port['id'], port['name'])) # https://review.openstack.org/#/c/46563/ merges in Neutron self._cleanup_ports(network['id'])

commit_message:
Send exists notification after completion of
resize and rebuild

Nova currently sends exists notifications only when the resize/rebuild
operations begin. When resize/rebuild span audit periods, this causes
some values from the period between the time that the previous audit
period ended to the time at which the rebuild/resize finishes, to be
ignored. This commit fixes that by sending another exists notification when
the resize/rebuild operations finish.

Implements: blueprint exists-post-resize-rebuild

Change-Id: I3dae7595a96eec554316666b08a483317316b0a3

commit_message:
Use uuid instead of uuidutils

The generate_uuid() functions will be deprecated/removed from uuidutils/
This patch replaces uuidutils.generate_uuid() with str(uuid.uuid4()).

Change-Id: I235deff20da145a84de9bad7091bbd531eb89c0f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/03/77503/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: from openstack_dashboard.openstack.common import uuidutils return 'req-%s' % uuidutils.generate_uuid()

added_lines: Configuring Glance Tasks ------------------------ Glance Tasks are implemented only for the version 2 of the Openstack Images API. The feature is turned on by default. The config value ``task_time_to_live`` is used to determine how long a task would live in the DB after transitioning to success or failure state. Setting a good value either high or low should be taken into consideration as per the need. * ``task_time_to_live=<Time_in_hours>`` Optional. Default: ``48``

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-28 08:47:37.000000000', 'files': ['mistralclient/tests/base.py', 'mistralclient/api/client.py', 'mistralclient/shell.py', 'mistralclient/api/httpclient.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-mistralclient/commit/df55840009c9bcac52a0e1a99faabc885e8a9052', 'message': 'Made keystone authentication optional

auth_token, user_id, project_id and mistral_url provided will be
directly transmitted to HTTPClient.

Also:
 * renamed input_auth_token as auth_token
 * optimized few checks
 * added checks to prevent header update when not needed

Change-Id: I1b34282956d21a1809ec37b0368fbb68aa113bea
Implements: blueprint mistral-optional-keystone-authentication
'}]
commit_message:
Made keystone authentication optional

You need to supply auth_url to authenticate using Keystone. Otherwise,
auth_token, user_id, project_id and mistral_url provided will be
directly transmitted to HTTPClient.

Also:
 * renamed input_auth_token as auth_token
 * optimized few checks
 * added checks to prevent header update when not needed
 * simplified API test setUp

Change-Id: I1b34282956d21a1809ec37b0368fbb68aa113bea
Implements: blueprint mistral-optional-keystone-authentication

commit_message:
Add Nova V2 API test for GET os-quota-class-sets

This patch adds "show a quota class set" tests for Nova V2.

NOTE: This api has been removed in Nova V3 API. So we shouldn't have the
V3 tests for that API.

Change-Id: I3d415a490d1c3c2b9e2fa8e14d4b5184256e0762
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/89/77489/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cls.quota_class_name = data_utils.rand_name('quota-class') @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_get_quota_class_sets(self): # Admin can get the quota class sets for it's tenant expected_quota_class_set = self.default_quota_set | set(['id']) resp, quota_class_set = self.adm_client.get_quota_class_set( self.quota_class_name) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(sorted(expected_quota_class_set), sorted(quota_class_set.keys())) self.assertEqual(quota_class_set['id'], self.quota_class_name)

commit_message:
Security groups workflow update

Reasons:
 - By telling to trove-taskmanager
   that it should create security group with
   datastore default port taskmanager should
   go into config and find default datastore
   specific ports and create custom rule
   for them. But now it creates rule
   which allows access to 3306 port - here comes bottleneck,
   this port should be custom for each datastore.

Changes:
 - Rules are not optional any more, because empty
   security group is meaningless. By allowing usage of
   security groups we telling that it should contain
   rule by default, which mean "not optional";
 - Adding option group for a specific datastore (mysql, redis);
 - Adding tcp and upd ports as possible options.

Implements: blueprint security-groups-workflow-update
Change-Id: Iaf3187ba89d0674f7921cbf92e5eb24de05abc6b

commit_message:
Remove http_handler config option in auth_token

This option was predominately used so that we could substitute a fake
handler in place so that we could mock our HTTP calls. This has been
replaced for some time now with httpretty so is no longer necessary.

Change-Id: I8613f4e189ee977f17b9606547840d5e7847d77a

Fix assertEqual arguments order(_ldap_tls_livetest, backend_kvs, etc)

('expected', 'actual') order.

subject: Implement glance image constraint
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-12 10:43:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/b3b29c847b5b4451e2913c4286edb7245adee033', 'message': 'Implement glance image constraint

This adds a new constraint validation glance images.

commit_message:
Remove rabbit_notifier (Sync notifier with oslo d6e1ba7)

rpc_notifier is available since grizzly, and rabbit_notifier
was printing deprecation messages since then. Remove it
for icehouse. This includes a sync to oslo-incubator, which
includes the following commits:

  aff0171 Remove "vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4" from headers
  8575d87 Removed copyright from empty files
  8b2b0b7 Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
  6fa29ae Trivial: Make vertical white space after license header
          consistent
  d7ae4ff Remove deprecated Grizzly features

DocImpact: Remove all references to rabbit_notifier and replace
it with rpc_notifier.

Change-Id: I889b43dfcebe6574dfa00ea50818f85732860d98

commit_message:
Use admin_prefix consistently

The auth_admin_prefix config option is used manually in a number of
places where it could just be set for all requests.

Change-Id: Ib690d69bdf075cf7095841a6ab9f419dfe8b1ca8

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-31 00:07:10.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/test_rbd.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/24a1bd855ed90d51de3b2a458f9c51a0fe6faa58', 'message': "Catch ImageBusy exception when deleting rbd volume

If we try to delete an rbd volume that has 'watchers' on it
i.e. client connections that have not yet been closed
possibly because a client crashed, the remove() will throw an
ImageBusy exception. We now catch this exception and raise
VolumeIsBusy with a useful message.

If the volume delete fails in this way it will now stay as
'available' instead of going to 'error_deleting' so that the
delete can be retried (since it is expected to work on a
retry after waiting for the connection to timeout).

Change-Id: I5bc9a5f71bdb0f9c5d12b5577e68377e66561f5b
Closes-bug: 1256259
(cherry picked from commit f31d62a178a370ae9d736c09a3186ea9a3c92ee3)
"}]
commit_message:
Catch ImageBusy exception when deleting rbd volume

If we try to delete an rbd volume that has 'watchers' on it
i.e. client connections that have not yet been closed
possibly because a client crashed, the remove() will throw an
ImageBusy exception. We now catch this exception and raise
VolumeIsBusy with a useful message.

If the volume delete fails in this way it will now stay as
'available' instead of going to 'error_deleting' so that the
delete can be retried (since it is expected to work on a
retry after waiting for the connection to timeout).

Change-Id: I5bc9a5f71bdb0f9c5d12b5577e68377e66561f5b
Closes-bug: 1256259
(cherry picked from commit f31d62a178a370ae9d736c09a3186ea9a3c92ee3)

demonstrate auth_token behavior with a simple echo service

Change-Id: I522faed9fb9d338fcaf9aeec37e04fd5078b6306
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/29/75529/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if __name__ == '__main__': """Run this module directly to start a protected echo service:: $ python -m keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token When the ``auth_token`` module authenticates a request, the echo service will respond with all the environment variables presented to it by this module. """ def echo_app(environ, start_response): """A WSGI application that echoes the CGI environment to the user.""" start_response('200 OK', [('Content-Type', 'application/json')]) environment = dict((k, v) for k, v in environ.iteritems() if k.startswith('HTTP_X_')) yield jsonutils.dumps(environment) from wsgiref import simple_server # hardcode any non-default configuration here conf = {'auth_protocol': 'http', 'admin_token': 'ADMIN'} app = AuthProtocol(echo_app, conf) server = simple_server.make_server('', 8000, app) print('Serving on port 8000 (Ctrl+C to end)...') server.serve_forever()

commit_message:
Fixes api samples for V2 os-assisted-volume-snapshots

Corrects the api samples for the V2 os-assisted-volume-snapshots.
The api samples for the create path were incorrect. This patch fixes
them so the documentation for the API will be correct. It doesn't fix
the input validation as it would be a backwards incompatible change.

Closes-Bug: 1286936

Change-Id: I66a9162e637e3d65bcbd7d033c6c173e67178fbe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/64/77464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix previous ips show twice when attaching interface

This case happened when triggering the interface-attach
action on a vm, since the nw_info of the vm will load
network info cache replicately, revert parts of the
commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/53969/4.

Closes-bug: #1272195

Change-Id: I1a341fe7c5fd080e05176ade9c89369c184aab6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/81/68881/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add mkfs to the baremetal-deploy-helper rootwrap

The nova-baremetal-deploy-helper uses the mkfs command to
format the ephemeral partition (if configured). The
command works today because it is also defined in the
compute.filters file but we should be explicit here.

Change-Id: I79c31ffd26ff92d35d3d9836f2a8954a9a07c2c0

commit_message:
Add command-line interface

Added CLI for every API we currently have.

Also:
 * fixed url in WorkbookManager.update
 * fixed project_id reconstruction by keystone
 * added check for empty string of project_id and project_name
 * added cliutils and log modules from oslo-incubator

Change-Id: I4e46de73b8f6ec858a466232aea53692278d486a
Implements: blueprint mistral-client-cli
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-mistralclient refs/changes/32/76832/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [entry_points] console_scripts = mistral = mistralclient.shell:main

commit_message:
be more careful about downing services

swift-proxy likes to not shut down during grenade runs, and the
failure case just means all our tests take forever timing out on
trying to connect to it over glance.

put in a few more checks about whether the services are in the
right states.

Change-Id: Iedfd91cdded632f7f3a2b5f127c2901f8762adaa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/88/76988/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: source $TARGET_DEVSTACK_DIR/functions-common SERVICE_CHECK=`service_check` if $SERVICE_CHECK; then echo "Failure to start some services" echo $SERVICE_CHECK exit 1 fi

commit_message:
Add send_email task to webhook example.

Add send_email action and service to the yaml,
and embed a mock smtpd service into the app to dump emails.

commit_message:
Change tenant network type usage for IB Fabric

This patch changes tenant network type usage for InfiniBand Fabric
to vlan type. Add the indication of Fabric Type (Ethernet/InfiniBand)
to the provider_network via the plugin configuration file.
If physical network type is not specified for some provider network
listed in the network_vlan_ranges, use default physical network type.

Co-authored-by: Roey Chen <roeyc@mellanox.com>
Change-Id: Id45acfb8234359a43303c2eee2205a44998c039a
Closes-Bug: 1263638

commit_message:
BigSwitch: Asynchronous rest calls for port create

Makes rest calls for port creation an async
operation so create_port calls immediately
return in a BUILD state.

Implements: blueprint bsn-port-async
Change-Id: Ib512a846fa878ec33205df08a3b2464b7ea0941a

commit_message:
Replace httplib.HTTPSConnection in unittests

SSL Verification is from now on enabled by default for the
TestOpenStackClient. So far no unittests was making actively use of
httplib.HTTPSConnection.

Intention is to reduce noise of audits/scanners which look for Python 2.x
httplib.HTTPSConnection missing SSL verification. By completely abandoning the use
of httplib.HTTPSConnection.

Change-Id: Ic0352cf453d5c41f09084a6d68b3393b8ddda84a
Partial-Bug: 1188189

commit_message:
Add boolean convertor to "create multiple servers" API

"create multiple servers" API contains "return_reservation_id" as an
attribute, and the attribute should be boolean. There are the other
boolean attributes such as "on_shared_storage" of evacuate API, they
can be passed with either boolean or string(e.g. "True"). For the
consistency of whole Nova APIs, this patch adds boolean convertors to
multiple_create API.

Change-Id: Id6f458a2ced869a31d5d25d661309973132e9360
Closes-Bug: #1281440

subject: Don't require the template if the image exists
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-05 12:49:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/211f31c6230bb4b8054fa6aef98854931e84eae2', 'message': "Don't cache template if the image already exists

With this change, when an image is initialized it won't try to fetch the
template if the image already exists. We can assume that when the image
already exists on disk there is no need for getting the template because
it is only required when creating the image for the first time.

This also prevents an issue when migrating an instance whose base image
had been deleted or made private for which the migration would fail
while fetching the template image.

Fixes #1206887

commit_message:
Downgrade the log level for floating IP associate

When a deallocating for an instance, it might find a floating
ip is already disassocated, this patch downgrade the loglevel
from exception to info and add floating ip address into the log.

Change-Id: I119c78270c2b24937484329e8fbaaa22546ea021

commit_message:
hyperv: Retry after WMI query fails to find dev

During long stress runs the WMI query that is looking for
the iSCSI device number can incorrectly return no data.
If the query is retried the appropriate data can then be
obtained.

This commit adds a retry loop, calling
basevolumeutils.get_device_number_for_target to avoid this situation.
It also handles the case where the devices list returned in
get_device_number_for_target is empty.  The retry loop is
implemented with new mounted_disk_query_retry_count and
mounted_disk_query_retry_interval configuration options.

Unit tests have been added to check the good and bad paths for
get_mounted_disk_from_lun.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: 1247901
Change-Id: I082c4b1694efcd20cce65293cd330b7a0cf7d470
(cherry picked from commit d143540ad1b69ec93c2b7bfadd1f654c4d8c7a34)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/71/72771/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.IntOpt('mounted_disk_query_retry_count', default=10, help='The number of times to retry checking for a disk mounted ' 'via iSCSI.'), cfg.IntOpt('mounted_disk_query_retry_interval', default=5, help='Interval between checks for a mounted iSCSI ' 'disk, in seconds.'), # The WMI query in get_device_number_for_target can incorrectly # return no data when the system is under load. This issue can # be avoided by adding a retry. for i in xrange(CONF.hyperv.mounted_disk_query_retry_count): device_number = self._volutils.get_device_number_for_target( target_iqn, target_lun) if device_number is None: attempt = i + 1 LOG.debug(_('Attempt %d to get device_number ' 'from get_device_number_for_target failed. ' 'Retrying...') % attempt) time.sleep(CONF.hyperv.mounted_disk_query_retry_interval) else: break

subject: VMware: Always upload a snapshot as a preallocated disk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-19 22:36:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmware_images.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9520b8dfc207d0183ef53e84a480270e832d6c70', 'message': "VMware: Always upload a snapshot as a preallocated disk

Currently, a snapshot operation always produces a preallocated
disk type. When the snapshot is uploaded to glance, the source
image metadata is uploaded with the new snapshot and then some
of the metadata properties are updated. The update doesn't
include the disk_type property, this can be problematic. If
the original image has a sparse disk type and a snapshot is
taken, then the snapshot which is a preallocated disk type is
uploaded to glance with the disk_type property set to sparse,
which creates a disk type mismatch and causes errors when a vm
is spawned from that snapshot. This patch addresses the issue
by correcting the image metadata used when uploading a snapshot
to glance.

Also, the image_upload function in vmwareapi/fake.py has been
modified to address the change. Any function call to
image_upload (from the unit tests) will assert that the
metadata for the image to be uploaded must have the disk_type
value to be preallocated.

Closes-Bug: 1247296
(cherry picked from commit 11e327f888a6dbde990d75196560083fddecf394)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
Change-Id: I71cfa8d4d1eb7911abb489153292fb0d1e614765
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: Always upload a snapshot as a preallocated disk

Currently, a snapshot operation always produces a preallocated
disk type. When the snapshot is uploaded to glance, the source
image metadata is uploaded with the new snapshot and then some
of the metadata properties are updated. The update doesn't
include the disk_type property, this can be problematic. If
the original image has a sparse disk type and a snapshot is
taken, then the snapshot which is a preallocated disk type is
uploaded to glance with the disk_type property set to sparse,
which creates a disk type mismatch and causes errors when a vm
is spawned from that snapshot. This patch addresses the issue
by correcting the image metadata used when uploading a snapshot
to glance.

Also, the image_upload function in vmwareapi/fake.py has been
modified to address the change. Any function call to
image_upload (from the unit tests) will assert that the
metadata for the image to be uploaded must have the disk_type
value to be preallocated.

Closes-Bug: 1247296
(cherry picked from commit 11e327f888a6dbde990d75196560083fddecf394)

commit_message:
xenapi plugins: Make sure subprocesses finish executing

Fixes bug 1286187

Neither execute_get_output() nor execute() would wait for the process to
fully finish executing. This could potentially create a race condition
where commands execute in a different order than intended.

Also, for execute() it could cause a process to never finish executing if
it generates enough output to block writing to the pipe.

Change-Id: I3404f4b3ca1cddeec2f3e7b393817a6ccc42bec7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/98/77198/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stdout = proc.communicate()[0] return stdout.strip() subprocess.call(command, close_fds=True, stdout=devnull, stderr=devnull)
deleted_lines: return proc.stdout.read().strip() proc = subprocess.Popen(command, close_fds=True, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=devnull)

commit_message:
Adds create backup server extension for the V3 API

Moves create_backup functionality out of admin_actions
into its own extension. This is part of blueprint v3-admin-actions-split
which allows more selective enablement of features contained
in the admin actions extension.

Note that XML api samples are no longer generated because bp
remove-v3-xml-api has been approved.

Partially implements bp v3-api-admin-actions-split
DocImpact: Adds os-create-backup extension and moves the
create_backup functionality out of os-admin-actions into
this new extension.

Change-Id: I4858a06df20c552bd55ff2841adbcfc761304f42

commit_message:
Remove "test-only" pam config options

Remove the "pam" configuration options that were only ever used for
testing purposes. Removes the test config file "backend_pam.conf"
by moving test_backend_pam.py to utilize proper configuration fixture
for identity driver. Since we no longer need the "pam.user" and
"pam.password" config options.

DocImpact

Related-Bug: #1229941
Change-Id: I3759ff7974948432900e3a73f3d87e5eed6e9828

subject: test_volume unittest fails if ran only this module
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-17 09:54:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/c1853677d4637edb3c341589fad6aed0d5f71a3d', 'message': "test_volume unittest fails if ran only this module

Using stevedore ExtensionManager to load entry_points(extensions)
before running any test case.

In BaseVolumeTestCase we have stubbed 'os.path.exists' call,
because of this stevedore is not able to load entry points paroperly.
Stevedore internally use pkg_resources and pkg_resources use
'os.path.exists' to check if entry_points.txt file exists or not.
Because of stubbibg it is returning True even if file do not exists.

Change-Id: I4fd6bee2e9f33c45ad3deacfe7359dc56171205e
Closes-Bug: #1263175
"}]
commit_message:
test_volume unittest fails if ran only this module

Using stevedore ExtensionManager to load entry_points(extensions)
before running any test case.

In BaseVolumeTestCase we have stubbed 'os.path.exists' call,
because of this stevedore is not able to load entry points paroperly.
Stevedore internally use pkg_resources and pkg_resources use
'os.path.exists' to check if entry_points.txt file exists or not.
Because of stubbibg it is returning True even if file do not exists.

Change-Id: I4fd6bee2e9f33c45ad3deacfe7359dc56171205e
Closes-Bug: #1263175
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/84/73984/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from stevedore import extension self.extension_manager = extension.ExtensionManager( "BaseVolumeTestCase")

commit_message:
Segment LUN clones in NetApp iSCSI

The NetApp ZAPI for clone_create and clone_start has a maximum size.
This fix breaks the lun into consumable sizes for the ZAPI.

Change-Id: Id4d0872c6099b7cfc73d806d772a3ae051a76b70
Closes-Bug: 1284182

commit_message:
Change RBD delete failure log level to warn

This is a recoverable issue in the backend, so we don't have to provide
the message on the error level.

Change-Id: I35711876b2c088ad28f32abd39248dc9a467d00d
Closes-Bug: #1256259

subject: Make DLO manifest copying work with ?multipart-manifest=get
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-28 07:41:54.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/slo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_dlo.py', 'swift/common/middleware/dlo.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/4f24ef87d6c272babe3f98d3f448a400a9ea8b1c', 'message': 'Make DLO manifest copying work with ?multipart-manifest=get

If a client issues a COPY request for a DLO with the query param
multipart-manifest=get, then the expectation is a new
manifest. However, this wasn't the case; X-Object-Manifest wasn't
being set on the new object, so the result was a normal object with
the same contents as the old manifest (typically 0 bytes).

There was already a mechanism by which middlewares could modify COPY
requests; this commit extends that so they can set headers on the new
object.

Note that this has nothing to do with a "normal" DLO copy, i.e. one
without multipart-manifest=get. That one makes a new object that's the
concatenation of the segments, and it was working just fine.

Change-Id: I1073af9fee6e34ebdfad7b1a89aeb05e4523a151
'}]
commit_message:
Make DLO manifest copying work with ?multipart-manifest=get

If a client issues a COPY request for a DLO with the query param
multipart-manifest=get, then the expectation is a new
manifest. However, this wasn't the case; X-Object-Manifest wasn't
being set on the new object, so the result was a normal object with
the same contents as the old manifest (typically 0 bytes).

There was already a mechanism by which middlewares could modify COPY
requests; this commit extends that so they can set headers on the new
object.

Note that this has nothing to do with a "normal" DLO copy, i.e. one
without multipart-manifest=get. That one makes a new object that's the
concatenation of the segments, and it was working just fine.

Change-Id: I1073af9fee6e34ebdfad7b1a89aeb05e4523a151
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/94/77094/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: env['swift.copy_hook'] = self.copy_hook( env.get('swift.copy_hook', lambda src_req, src_resp, sink_req: src_resp)) def copy_hook(self, inner_hook): def dlo_copy_hook(source_req, source_resp, sink_req): x_o_m = source_resp.headers.get('X-Object-Manifest') if x_o_m: if source_req.params.get('multipart-manifest') == 'get': # To copy the manifest, we let the copy proceed as normal, # but ensure that X-Object-Manifest is set on the new # object. sink_req.headers['X-Object-Manifest'] = x_o_m else: ctx = GetContext(self, self.logger) source_resp = ctx.get_or_head_response( source_req, x_o_m, source_resp.headers.items()) return inner_hook(source_req, source_resp, sink_req)
deleted_lines: env['swift.copy_response_hook'] = self.copy_response_hook( env.get('swift.copy_response_hook', lambda req, resp: resp)) def copy_response_hook(self, inner_hook): def dlo_copy_hook(req, resp): x_o_m = resp.headers.get('X-Object-Manifest') if (x_o_m and req.params.get('multipart-manifest') != 'get'): resp = GetContext(self, self.logger).get_or_head_response( req, x_o_m, resp.headers.items()) return inner_hook(req, resp)

subject: Fix assertEqual arguments order(backend_ldap, cache, v3_protection)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-20 05:17:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/e63c6dbdb21e49f21f4d5ca054533484ff5e4f51', 'message': "Fix assertEqual arguments order

assertEqual method's arguments should be in
('expected', 'actual') order.

This patch fixes this problem of the following modules:
* keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py
* keystone/tests/test_cache.py
* keystone/tests/test_v3_protection.py

Partially Close-bug: #1277104

Change-Id: I311590525bfebd3c587af6a94f6989df66dc2064
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-24 10:19:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_cache.py', 'keystone/tests/test_v3_protection.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/73d5422768a7bdf145a4a97daceffdbd164b2b71', 'message': "Fix assertEqual arguments order(backend_ldap, cache, v3_protection)

('expected', 'actual') order.

"}]
commit_message:
Fix assertEqual arguments order(backend_ldap, cache, v3_protection)

assertEqual method's arguments should be in
('expected', 'actual') order.

Partial-Bug: #1277104

Change-Id: I311590525bfebd3c587af6a94f6989df66dc2064
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/27/74927/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Include proper Content-Type in the HTTP response headers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-24 15:28:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/09bf79f4c54a387f2bc8eea8a77b71e83386651c', 'message': 'Fixes the issue #1243878

Including the HTTP headers in the HTTP response.
Changes done in neutron-ns-metadata-proxy and neutron-metadata-agent.

Closes-Bug #1243878
Change-Id: If68f0b508fbea4ecd1eb0e58d602b5ba6ccbe263
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-25 07:09:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5d24d31bda588fd442d5d1793d42f3a34265e604', 'message': 'Fixes the issue #1243878

Neutron namespace proxy handler and metadata agent were not setting the
Content-Type in its response. Both of them were returning only the response
data which is obtained from the nova-metadata-service. Since they were returning
only the response data, the Content-Type returned to the clients has the default
one which is - "text/html". Ideally this should be set to the data type which is
present in the HTTP Response. The fix now includes the Content-Type which is
returned by nova-metadata-service.

Closes-Bug:#1243878
Change-Id: If68f0b508fbea4ecd1eb0e58d602b5ba6ccbe263
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-25 08:57:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/dba27adf2b529a3dc254b4d2cea991be25ba2078', 'message': 'Include proper Content-Type in the HTTP response headers.

Neutron namespace proxy handler and metadata agent were not setting the
Content-Type in its response. Both of them were returning only the response
data which is obtained from the nova-metadata-service. Since they were returning
only the response data, the Content-Type returned to the clients has the default
one which is - "text/html". Ideally this should be set to the data type which is

commit_message:
Include proper Content-Type in the HTTP response headers

Neutron namespace proxy handler and metadata agent were not setting the
Content-Type in its response. Both of them were returning only the response
data which is obtained from the nova-metadata-service. Since they were returning
only the response data, the Content-Type returned to the clients has the default
one which is - "text/html". Ideally this should be set to the data type which is
present in the HTTP Response. The fix now includes the Content-Type which is
returned by nova-metadata-service

Closes-Bug: #1243878
Change-Id: If68f0b508fbea4ecd1eb0e58d602b5ba6ccbe263

commit_message:
Fix type-delete to allow deletion by name and ID

This change addresses bug #1286314, fixing type deletion to allow
deletion by either volume type name or ID. The former implementation
only accepted the volume type ID. Help documentation is also updated
to reflect this change.

Change-Id: I0fc66b54a7bcfa4e00a4d136ac513fa40e628dd2
Closes-Bug: #1286314
DocImpact

commit_message:
Remove paste_deploy from test_overrides.conf

There's a default for paste_deploy, so it doesn't have to be set
in test_overrides.conf.

Change-Id: I6316eb113efbd16de91e16a3f5974005989d7dd8
