commit_message:
Change firewall to DOWN when admin state down

Currently firewall remains in status "ACTIVE" after admin state
is changed to DOWN.

This fix sets firewall status to "DOWN" if admin state is updated
from "UP" to "DOWN". "DOWN" status is used by other network resources
so use "DOWN" to keep consistent.

Change-Id: If316b114c4df78368b43c2a15a820bb1177b3a54
Closes-Bug: 1279213

commit_message:
Add api tests for neutron router

Add tests for:
- Update router administrative state
- Add several interfaces (to different subnets) to a router
Add improvements for:
- When removing an interface, assert correct subnet id from the response
- When removing an interface, assert correct port id from the response

according to https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/icehouse-summit-qa-neutron

Change-Id: I538e8bed2f5c726ebd610d406702d4ef9de88723

added_lines: @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_update_router_admin_state(self): self.router = self.create_router(data_utils.rand_name('router-')) self.assertFalse(self.router['admin_state_up']) # Update router admin state resp, update_body = self.client.update_router(self.router['id'], admin_state_up=True) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) self.assertTrue(update_body['router']['admin_state_up']) resp, show_body = self.client.show_router(self.router['id']) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) self.assertTrue(show_body['router']['admin_state_up']) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_add_multiple_router_interfaces(self): network = self.create_network() subnet01 = self.create_subnet(network) subnet02 = self.create_subnet(network) router = self.create_router(data_utils.rand_name('router-')) interface01 = self._add_router_interface_with_subnet_id(router['id'], subnet01['id']) self._verify_router_interface(router['id'], subnet01['id'], interface01['port_id']) interface02 = self._add_router_interface_with_subnet_id(router['id'], subnet02['id']) self._verify_router_interface(router['id'], subnet02['id'], interface02['port_id']) def _add_router_interface_with_subnet_id(self, router_id, subnet_id): resp, interface = self.client.add_router_interface_with_subnet_id( router_id, subnet_id) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) self.addCleanup(self._remove_router_interface_with_subnet_id, router_id, subnet_id) self.assertEqual(subnet_id, interface['subnet_id']) return interface def _verify_router_interface(self, router_id, subnet_id, port_id): resp, show_port_body = self.client.show_port(port_id) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) interface_port = show_port_body['port'] self.assertEqual(router_id, interface_port['device_id']) self.assertEqual(subnet_id, interface_port['fixed_ips'][0]['subnet_id'])

commit_message:
Alarm support in HBase Part 1

Two additional tables are introduced for alarms and alarm_history.
Ordering in alarm_history was achived by that fact that HBase
stores entries in alphabetical order. It is needed to enlarge the
preciseness of reverse_timestamp because alarms history entries may be
generated once per second, especially in tests.

Partially implements bp hbase-alarming

Change-Id: I41bc60f13779899af0e8f8e01f85b2ee6d1c8aae

commit_message:
nova changes for multinode working under -o errexit

There was a stray inicomment on paste outside of a nova-api block. This
fails under -o errexit because the paste.ini doesn't exist.

Move this to inside the correct block.

Change-Id: Iffbdae6716a1c2a8f650b68edd4faf436434eab1

commit_message:
Source lib/neutron in boot_from_volume.sh

Without lib/neutron, boot_from_volume.sh generates the following
error:

  + _ping_check_neutron private 10.11.12.5 30
  /devstack/functions: line 356: _ping_check_neutron: command not found

Change-Id: Ib72c3f24d614570d69bf5dda35cbaf5847b1d1b9

commit_message:
Add user-supplied arguments in log_handler

Sync from Oslo, change-id: I91289cc4a60f5dab89bca852e6f52b4b83831e47

When using PublishErrorsHandler, it will missing user-supplied
arguments. For example, do LOG.info("blabla %s", "foo"), the
payload only contains "blabla %s", but we expect it like "blabla foo".

Change-Id: I9e5515da31a04b82d49e406bc6b246f940fb73fc

commit_message:
Deprecate conductor instance_type_get() and remove from VirtAPI

The flavor_get() in VirtAPI and instance_type_get() in conductor are
no longer needed by the virt drivers. This patch deprecates the
function in conductor's API and removes it everywhere else.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I782ee449df98a198f625b946c650ebff56711b8e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/69/71369/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sitepackages = False

commit_message:
Make compute manager use InstanceInfoCache object for deletes

This patch makes compute manager use the InstanceInfoCache object
that is already in the instance to delete the cache while deleting
the instance.

It also fixes two tests that were still passing non-object
instance dicts to the method, which wasn't reflective of reality.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I829bd2d3828c01c18f3479375bea22e7f4be9d97
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/83/71383/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
VMware: fix datastore selection when token is returned

Use the token returned by the PropertyCollector to iterate
over the complete set of datastores and select the best
match based on the regular expression and the free space on
the datastore.

Closes-Bug: #1245564
Change-Id: If24c37a41bfa994a990aaa4a3e21d16b33aad42f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/61/54361/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _select_datastore(data_stores, best_match, datastore_regex=None): """Find the most preferable datastore in a given RetrieveResult object. :param best_match: tuple representing the current best match for datastore #TODO(hartsocks): refactor driver to use DSRecord namedtuple # using DSRecord through out will help keep related information # together and improve readability and organisation of the code. best_match = DSRecord(*best_match) # favor datastores with more free space if new_ds.freespace > best_match.freespace: best_match = new_ds return tuple(best_match) """Get the datastore list and choose the most preferable one.""" best_match = (None, None, None, 0) while data_stores: best_match = _select_datastore(data_stores, best_match, datastore_regex) if not token: break data_stores = session._call_method(vim_util, "continue_to_get_objects", token) if best_match[0]: return best_match if datastore_regex: raise exception.DatastoreNotFound( _("Datastore regex %s did not match any datastores") % datastore_regex.pattern) else: raise exception.DatastoreNotFound()
deleted_lines: def _get_datastore_ref_and_name(data_stores, datastore_regex=None): # selects the datastore with the most freespace """Find a usable datastore in a given RetrieveResult object. # we lean on checks performed in caller methods to validate the # datastore reference is not None. If it is, the caller handles # a None reference as appropriate in its context. found_ds = DSRecord(datastore=None, name=None, capacity=None, freespace=0) # find the largest freespace to return if new_ds.freespace > found_ds.freespace: found_ds = new_ds #TODO(hartsocks): refactor driver to use DSRecord namedtuple # using DSRecord through out will help keep related information # together and improve readability and organisation of the code. if found_ds.datastore is not None: return (found_ds.datastore, found_ds.name, found_ds.capacity, found_ds.freespace) """Get the datastore list and choose the first local storage.""" while data_stores: results = _get_datastore_ref_and_name(data_stores, datastore_regex) if results: if token: session._call_method(vim_util, "cancel_retrieve", token) return results if token: data_stores = session._call_method(vim_util, "continue_to_get_objects", token) else: if datastore_regex: raise exception.DatastoreNotFound( _("Datastore regex %s did not match any datastores") % datastore_regex.pattern) else: raise exception.DatastoreNotFound() raise exception.DatastoreNotFound()

commit_message:
use ensure_packages to install common-package

  - depreceate parameter package_ensure (not used anymore)
  - use ensure_package for common-package
  - fixes issue when common is installed for other services
    (see Change-Id: I91098bd3f13ee4391dcf1b870705c0a0c5566acc,
     where alarm_package is equal to common for ubuntu/debian
     in stable/havana branch)

Change-Id: I4bb2f54afc9fca21dc4734b09d7d853404a7ea7c
backport: havana
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/15/77115/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # DEPRECATED: not used anymore. # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $package_ensure = false if ($package_ensure ) { warning('Parameter package_ensure is depreceated an not used anymore') } ensure_packages([$::ceilometer::params::common_package_name])

commit_message:
Make restore_instance pass the Instance object to compute manager

The compute/api code already receives and uses an object, but
converts it to a dict before sending it down. This plumbs the
instance object all the way through to the driver.

This also converts the old compute_api non-unity test to a
proper unit test in test_compute_api, per usual when converting
API calls to objects.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects
Related to blueprint virt-objects

Change-Id: Ic2d7d14c50d85556ed1170f7d026c9d84423c876

commit_message:
Devstack install can fail on missing xinetd.d/rsync config

Assuming if the system does not have the xinetd.d/rsync,
the dedicated service is the prefered way.

Change-Id: Ic42651c5c3fb5bf0099786ca81a7bd06ace896a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/99/77099/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -e /etc/xinetd.d/rsync ]; then sudo sed -i '/disable *= *yes/ { s/yes/no/ }' /etc/xinetd.d/rsync else cat <<EOF | sudo tee /etc/xinetd.d/rsync service rsync { disable = no socket_type = stream wait = no user = root server = /usr/bin/rsync server_args = --daemon log_on_failure += USERID } EOF fi

commit_message:
Make EMC SMI-S driver unit tests faster.

Some of EMC SMI-S driver unit tests are very slow.
This patch uses a fake_sleep in unit tests to return right away.

Change-Id: Ia8a429799066ccde51079be68408498805869774
Closes-Bug: #1285927

commit_message:
Change Stack timestamps to save correct info

Stack.updated_time is currently being treated as modification time of
the object in the database.  Since it's not a very useful thing to have
and the CFN API treats this value as "the last time an update call was
issued", it makes sense to have the same behavior here as well.

This changes the current real-time retrieval of created_time and
updated_time in favor of the attributes already present in the stack and
changes the information stored in these two fields to be the time the
stack was created and the time the stack was last updated by the user,
respectively.

Co-Authored-By: Anderson Mesquita <andersonvom@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1193269
Change-Id: I1fd6586b827b3f2babb5af5c85f9de25da74fbb6

commit_message:
oauth1 extension migration fails with DB2

Running keystone-manage db_sync --extension oauth1 would fail when
using DB2 with an error that the REQUESTED_ROLES column isn't
defined on the REQUEST_TOKEN table.

This problem is worked around by dropping the NULL constraint
first and then renaming the column.

Change-Id: I58438cad4d645c553da5710455e8a219b8fd3014
Closes-Bug: #1284740
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/71/76271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Implement an EC2 Controller that returns a V3 token when invoked
via the V3 pipeline. Moved all code except the `authenticate` method
into a common base class mixin. `authenticate()` has become an
abstract method. Shared code from `authenticate()` was moved into
`_authenticate()`.

V3 specific router definition added that makes use of the new V3
specific controller.

For upgrade purposes, the paste.ini for keystone will need to
be modified to include the new V3 ec2credentials in the pipeline
as is outlines in the new sample paste.ini.

For authentication that occurs via the V3 ec2credential system,
the response auth_method (encoded in the token) will be
"ec2credential". This should have no impact on using
or consuming the token itself but can be used to identify if
the token was issued via the Ec2ControllerV3.authenticate
method.

The V2 version of ec2credential controller has been marked
as deprecated to keep in line with the rest of the V2 API
being deprecated (slated for removal in K).

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: Iaf1e05a1beef481385c6eb19d7f54cdc84b5b5df
Closes-Bug: #1269947

commit_message:
Implement V3 Specific Version of EC2 Contrib

Implement an EC2 Controller that returns a V3 token when invoked
via the V3 pipeline. Moved all code except the `authenticate` method
into a common base class mixin. `authenticate()` has become an
abstract method. Shared code from `authenticate()` was moved into
`_authenticate()`.

V3 specific router definition added that makes use of the new V3
specific controller.

For upgrade purposes:
* The paste.ini for keystone will need to be modified to include
  the new V3 ec2credentials in the pipeline as is documented in
  the updated sample paste.ini.
* Policy.json updated to provide rules for the new V3 EC2credential
  CRUD as show in the updated sample policy.json and
  policy.v3cloudsample.json

For authentication that occurs via the V3 ec2credential system,
the response auth_method (encoded in the token) will be
"ec2credential". This should have no impact on using
or consuming the token itself but can be used to identify if
the token was issued via the Ec2ControllerV3.authenticate
method.

The V2 version of ec2credential controller has been marked
as deprecated to keep in line with the rest of the V2 API
being deprecated (slated for removal in K).

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: Iaf1e05a1beef481385c6eb19d7f54cdc84b5b5df
Closes-Bug: #1269947

commit_message:
Use uuid instead of name for lvm backend

Because libvirt lvm volumes are based on instance['name'], it means
that the actual names used in lvm storage are based on an operator
configuration variable: instance_name_template (default is
'instance-%08x').

However this is site changeable, and changeable at any time. This
creates 2 failure modes.

1. Operator changes this, the result is all volumes created before the
change are no longer able to be cleaned up by nova

2. Operator has changed this to something that includes end user
input, like %(display_name), which would allow one user to impact
another (user A has display name "bob", user B has display name
"bob_joe")

This changes the lvm backend to use instance['uuid'] as it's
identifier which we know is unique, non overlapping, and not
changeable based on whims of site policy.

It also provides limited backwards compatibility for cleaning up old
disks if the installation was using the default template (which is
safe), otherwise it logs a warning about possibly leaking a disk which
will need to be manually cleaned up. That should be removed once we
open the Juno tree.

UpgradeImpact - while there is no operator action required to upgrade
over this change, if the nova install included a non default value for
instance_name_template then old lvm volumes will need to be cleaned up
manually after old guests are destroyed.

Change-Id: Ib36b962971fd1f66ea9a0818e91fec59e118e686
Closes-Bug: #1285735

commit_message:
Integration tests - running the tests

Initial setup for running the integration tests. A basic test is
included to ensure this works, although it will be rewritten to follow
the Page Object pattern. Thanks to Daniel Korn for the initial test.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/Testing/UI

Implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: Id5b62cdeac5295667a3922f7bed1db3c7617f841

commit_message:
New libvirt secion

This change moves the libvirt_options to their own libvirt sextion
as per docs http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content//list-of-compute-config-options.html

Change-Id: I6067e38caf9dcae93049d15476af2cc172e87870

commit_message:
Make the metadata namespace proxy transparent

Refactor the namespace proxy to make it transparent for all http requests
and responses that pass through, so that they are forwarded as if they were made
by their original source. This will allow us to support any upcoming changes
in the metadata service with minimal changes from the Neutron part.

Closes-Bug: #1175955
Change-Id: Iedf3ebb86e342bd8699fca45fc2a934d2ea31730

proxy_req.assert_called_once_with(req.remote_addr, req.path_info, req.query_string) def test_call_internal_server_error(self): req = mock.Mock(headers={}) with mock.patch.object(self.handler, '_proxy_request') as proxy_req: proxy_req.side_effect = Exception retval = self.handler(req) self.assertIsInstance(retval, webob.exc.HTTPInternalServerError) self.assertEqual(len(self.log.mock_calls), commit_message:
Add missing ComputeNode fields

host_ip, supported_instances, pci_stats, and extra_resources were
missing from the ComputeNode object. Also, the 'stats' entry needs
to support all primitives as values, not just strings.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I4b45574a8bee0c9ad1c014b13db312c3ab618950

commit_message:
Add compound fields for primitives

This adds DictOfNullablePrimitives and ListOfDictOfNullablePrimitives
fields. These will be used for ComputeNode.stats and ComputeNode.pci_stats
respectively.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I153366e402e83b0249dc6b01b7670a1b0ca368bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/75297/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class DictOfNullablePrimitives(AutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE = Dict(FieldType(), nullable=True) class ListOfDictOfNullablePrimitives(AutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE = List(Dict(FieldType(), nullable=True))

commit_message:
lbaas/haproxy/agent: use neutron.service instead of rpc.service

lbaas haproxy agent defines periodic_interval option in DEFAULT group
which is inconsistent the same option defined by other agents/servers.
The inconsistency causes a confusion.  Since even major distro
document misses this difference, almost all the admins can't
understand it.
  default value: 10(haproxy) vs 40(others)
  behaviour: neutron.openstack.common.rpc.service.Service.threadgroup(haproxy)
             vs neutron.service.Service(others)

So make haproxy agent use neutron.service instead of
neutron.openstack.common.rpc.service and eliminate haproxy agent specific
definition.

Closes-Bug: #1282483
Change-Id: I0e079f8474bb088c22f99e7fa5e9bb205fd0d13a

commit_message:
grep may be fooled in aggregate.sh

In exit_if_aggregate_present function, we first 'nova aggregate-list',
grep output for aggregate_name variable.

The grep may be fooled, if the previous command has failed.

Change-Id: I728ebce6718e08dddb0a3550d4d05cfa692c87f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/33/53233/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: val=$(nova aggregate-list | grep -c " $aggregate_name ") if [[ $? -eq 0 ]] && [[ $val == 0 ]]; then die $LINENO "fail to get aggregate or found aggregate: $aggregate_name"
deleted_lines: if [ $(nova aggregate-list | grep -c " $aggregate_name ") == 0 ]; then die $LINENO "found aggregate: $aggregate_name"

commit_message:
Update oslo.config sample generation tools

Our update config tools are a bit old.  This patch brings in
the latest from oslo-incubator.  Update heat.conf.sample using
updated config generator

Change-Id: I995899804135c4d1585bb745ab39ad745c89cffb
blueprint: oslo-messaging
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/87/75187/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import argparseimport stevedore.nameddef generate(argv): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description='generate sample configuration file', ) parser.add_argument('-m', dest='modules', action='append') parser.add_argument('-l', dest='libraries', action='append') parser.add_argument('srcfiles', nargs='*') parsed_args = parser.parse_args(argv) for filepath in parsed_args.srcfiles: pkg_names = sorted(pkg for pkg in mods_by_pkg if pkg.endswith(PY_EXT)) ext_names = sorted(pkg for pkg in mods_by_pkg if pkg not in pkg_names) if parsed_args.modules: for module_name in parsed_args.modules: # Look for entry points defined in libraries (or applications) for # option discovery, and include their return values in the output. # # Each entry point should be a function returning an iterable # of pairs with the group name (or None for the default group) # and the list of Opt instances for that group. if parsed_args.libraries: loader = stevedore.named.NamedExtensionManager( 'oslo.config.opts', names=list(set(parsed_args.libraries)), invoke_on_load=False, ) for ext in loader: for group, opts in ext.plugin(): opt_list = opts_by_group.setdefault(group or 'DEFAULT', []) opt_list.append((ext.name, opts)) for value in group._opts.values(): # NOTE(llu): Temporary workaround for bug #1262148, wait until # newly released oslo.config support '==' operator. if not(value['opt'] != opt): for value in cfg.CONF.values(): return 'oslo'
deleted_lines: def generate(srcfiles): for filepath in srcfiles: pkg_names = filter(lambda x: x.endswith(PY_EXT), mods_by_pkg.keys()) pkg_names.sort() ext_names = filter(lambda x: x not in pkg_names, mods_by_pkg.keys()) ext_names.sort() extra_modules = os.getenv("HEAT_CONFIG_GENERATOR_EXTRA_MODULES", "") if extra_modules: for module_name in extra_modules.split(','): module_name = module_name.strip() for key, value in group._opts.items(): if value['opt'] == opt: for key, value in cfg.CONF.items(): return 'heat'

commit_message:
Oslo config option changed by test causing problem

When running this test via tox, non-deterministically tests will fail
because the cloud backend gets changed, which will cause pyrax to get
imported. By setting the config option back to normal after the test
we avoid this error.

Change-Id: I28194a223883cde1884b1b0e8a810bc3e9d4c2f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/57/74157/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support multiple active scheduler policies/configurations

Allows maintaining multiple active scheduler policies/configurations
within a single Nova deployment.
Policy/configuration is selected based on availability zone (more
options to be supported later).
Scheduler parameters (filters, options, etc) are overridden
based on selected policy configuration.

Partially implements blueprint multiple-scheduler-drivers

DocImpact

Change-Id: I63109110f373324e7e81841f42a6cb21127c3386

deleted_lines: def _choose_host_filters(self, filter_cls_names): if filter_cls_names is None: filter_cls_names = CONF.scheduler_default_filters filter_classes = self._choose_host_filters(filter_class_names)

commit_message:
conf overrides in scheduler

Allow various options for dynamic overriding of conf options

Partially implements blueprint multiple-scheduler-drivers

Change-Id: If88ec6c18a8095f67cbd020e966bd13ae13f06c2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/94/61794/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova import contextfrom nova.scheduler import conf as scheduler_conftest_get_config_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('FakeStrOpt', default='DefStrOpt', help='Test get_config StrOpt'), ] CONF.register_opts(test_get_config_opts) class GetConfigTestCase(test.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(GetConfigTestCase, self).setUp() self.context = context.get_admin_context() def _create_aggregate(self, name, metadata, hosts): values = {'name': name} result = db.aggregate_create(self.context.elevated(), values, metadata) for host in hosts: db.aggregate_host_add(self.context.elevated(), result['id'], host) return result def test_without_conf_overrides(self): filter_properties = {'context': self.context.elevated()} self.assertEqual('DefStrOpt', scheduler_conf.BaseConf().get_config( 'FakeStrOpt', filter_properties)) def test_with_conf_overrides(self): filter_properties = {'context': self.context.elevated(), 'conf_overrides': {'FakeStrOpt': 'ConfStrOpt'}} self.assertEqual('ConfStrOpt', scheduler_conf.FilterPropOverrideConf(). get_config('FakeStrOpt', filter_properties)) def test_without_aggregate_overrides(self): filter_properties = {'context': self.context.elevated()} self._create_aggregate('agg1', {}, ['host1']) self.assertEqual(set(['DefStrOpt']), scheduler_conf. AggregateOverrideConf().get_config('FakeStrOpt', filter_properties, 'host1')) def test_with_aggregate_overrides(self): filter_properties = {'context': self.context.elevated()} self._create_aggregate('agg1', {'FakeStrOpt': 'Agg1StrOpt'}, ['host1']) self._create_aggregate('agg2', {'FakeStrOpt': 'Agg2StrOpt'}, ['host1']) self.assertEqual(set(['Agg1StrOpt', 'Agg2StrOpt']), scheduler_conf.AggregateOverrideConf().get_config( 'FakeStrOpt', filter_properties, 'host1'))

Add db api to get aggregate by key value

Get a list of aggregates that are set with specific key,value pair.

Partially implements blueprint multiple-scheduler-drivers

added_lines: def aggregate_get_by_metadata_key_and_value(context, key, value): query = model_query(context, models.Aggregate) query = query.join("_metadata") query = query.options(contains_eager("_metadata")) query = query.filter(and_(models.AggregateMetadata.key == key, models.AggregateMetadata.value == value)) rows = query.all() metadata = collections.defaultdict(set) aggregates = [] for agg in rows: aggregates.append(aggregate_get(context, agg.id)) return aggregates @require_admin_context

commit_message:
Leverage unified conf overrides in scheduler

Leverage the common logic of overriding conf options with aggregate metadata
in filters.

Partially implements blueprint multiple-scheduler-drivers

Change-Id: Iedbc62d7a6b49fbcaa637eaa21c55ac1db5e6b72

added_lines: from nova.scheduler import conf as scheduler_conf def _choose_host_filters(self, filter_cls_names, filter_properties=None): if filter_cls_names is None: filter_cls_names = scheduler_conf.FilterPropOverrideConf( ).get_config('scheduler_default_filters', filter_properties) filter_classes = self._choose_host_filters(filter_class_names, filter_properties)

subject: VMware: Fix vim logout during GC of VMwareAPISession
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-03 12:23:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/342284635adbb37850b2524b26d5a8c95b1d1989', 'message': "VMware: Fix vim logout during GC of VMwareAPISession

VMwareAPISession.__del__ was doing:

  if hasattr(self, 'vim') and self.vim:
      self.vim.Logout(self.vim.get_service_content().sessionManager)

The check 'self.vim' is translated by python in the first instance
into a call to self.vim.__nonzero__(). However, Vim implements
__getattr__, so this was being translated into a call to
vim_request_handler(). This raised an exception because it was called
with an incorrect number of arguments. Consequently, the line
self.vim.Logout(...) was never called.

Change-Id: I04672db565f4f5fb38923990fead5e79b433628f

commit_message:
VMware: Fix vim logout during GC of VMwareAPISession

VMwareAPISession.__del__ was doing:

  if hasattr(self, 'vim') and self.vim:
      self.vim.Logout(self.vim.get_service_content().sessionManager)

The check 'self.vim' is translated by python in the first instance
into a call to self.vim.__nonzero__(). However, Vim implements
__getattr__, so this was being translated into a call to
vim_request_handler(). This raised an exception because it was called
with an incorrect number of arguments. Consequently, the line
self.vim.Logout(...) was never called.

Closes-bug: #1275773
Change-Id: I04672db565f4f5fb38923990fead5e79b433628f

commit_message:
Remove db layer policy checks for pci

This patch removes policy checks in db layer for pci,
and related unittests. The checks was already in pci
api v3, the v2 pci patches are under review, we also
add the policy checks into the new patches. So the
checks in db layer can be removed.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: Icbcd960fe6b48f41d0ddef7bc243329e1ee2440f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/73167/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Added keystone token cleanup script

pt-archiver script will run on a cron task
to purge tokens from keystone tokens table
periodically to prevent the database from
growing too large.

Added necessary dependencies for
installation on Red Hat.

Change-Id: Ic3aa5489069f8fdbc9a251eaaac7f90a805db1ea
Closes-Bug: 1274756
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/78/74978/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/sh set -eu KEYSTONE_DB="<%= db_name %>" KEYSTONE_DB_TYPE="<%= db_type %>" if [ "$KEYSTONE_DB_TYPE" != "mysql" ] ; then # We can just call this directly if bug #1188378 is ever fixed exec keystone-manage token_flush fi KEYSTONE_DB_USER="<%= db_user %>" KEYSTONE_DB_PASS="<%= db_pass %>" pt-archiver --source "h=$KEYSTONE_DB_HOST,u=$KEYSTONE_DB_USER,p=$KEYSTONE_DB_PASS,D=$KEYSTONE_DB_NAME,t=token" \ --charset utf8 \ --where "expires < UTC_TIMESTAMP()" \ --purge \ --txn-size 500 \ --run-time 59m \ --statistics \ --primary-key-only 2>&1 | logger -t cleanup-keystone-tokens

subject: Merges config_drive into servers core for V3 API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-17 01:57:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2270d77df32378bbef285f6cae9a0d8f90666b2c', 'message': 'Merges config_drive into servers core for V3 API

As discussed at the icehouse mid cycle meetup, merge the
config drive extension into the servers core for the V3 API.
This functionality is now widely supported and considered fundamental
to all hypervisors for Nova.

Note that there is no longer any support in V3 API for policy control
of whether config drive information is returned.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

commit_message:
Merges config_drive into servers core for V3 API

As discussed at the icehouse mid cycle meetup, merge the
config drive extension into the servers core for the V3 API.
This functionality is now widely supported and considered fundamental
to all hypervisors for Nova.

Note that there is no longer any support in V3 API for policy control
of whether config drive information is returned.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I2210cecca81f4a7a923cd6f12aba8e8f5aab0e63

Merges block_device_manager into servers core for V3 API

As discussed at the icehouse mid cycle meetup, merge the
block_device_manager extension into the servers core for the V3 API.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-core

commit_message:
Move policy check of compute:get_console_output to api layer

This patch moves "get_console_output" to api layer for nova api v2, and uses
"compute_extension:v3:console-output:get_console_output" for v3 api. Also removes
policy check from compute api and add related tests.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: Id5e0a2016b12b41877cf18a69fc2001df6d671fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/65640/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: authorize(context, target=instance, action='get_console_output')

commit_message:
Move policy check of rebuild/create_image to api layer

This patch moves "compute:rebuild/snapshot" to api layer for ec2 and nova
api v2, and uses "compute:v3:servers:rebuild/create_image" for nova api v3.
Also removes policy check from compute api. And give default rules
for v3 policy check.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I37a6b3548cd3f9a070f43cae8f2f79effd18eb8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/39/64239/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.api.openstack import extensions extensions.check_compute_policy(context, 'rebuild', instance) extensions.check_compute_policy(context, 'snapshot', instance)

commit_message:
Move policy check of create into api layer

This patch moves 'compute:create', 'compute:create:attach_network',
'compute:create:attach_volume' into api layer. v2 and ec2 api will
keep the same name. v3 api will use 'compute:v3:servers' as the scope
of policy.

For 'compute:create:attach_volume', it moves into block-device-mapping
extension. For support that, adds request context as the params for
server extension point.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic40a74088fc2fc88ef963ba2f9ac05bea0681c91

commit_message:
Move policy check of set_admin_password to api layer

This patch moves check of set_admin_password to api layer,
adds "compute:set_admin_password" for nova api v2 and uses
"compute_extension:v3:os-admin-password" for nova api v3.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I645beb68537077f2637c60d82dbd3e739046d3bf

commit_message:
Remove db layer policy checks for cell

This patch removes policy checks in db layer for cell.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

UpgradeImpact: There is no longer a secondary check in the db layer
and the policy specified for "compute_extension:cells" is the
only restriction for v2 api. If the policy has changed to empty, it need
update to "compute_extension:cells": "rule:admin_api" at aleast.

Change-Id: I70c9eb8d248c54557bc3de3e8bca71cea02b7e82

commit_message:
Move policy check of get into API layer

This patch move policy 'compute:get' into api layer
for ec2 and nova v2 api. And use 'compute:v3:servers:show'
for v3 api.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic5d98c1019143cea91c825ee445ea6f206775060

commit_message:
Move policy check of attach_interface/detach_interface to api layer

This patch moves "compute:attach_interface/detach_interface" to api layer
nova api v2, and uses "compute_extension:v3:os-attach-interfaces:create/delete"
and separated authroize for each actions for v3 api. Also removes policy check
from compute api. Add related tests and fix some nit in test_attach_interfaces.py.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I6620542c86005cc128d5948655ba2d16a9d37196

commit_message:
Remove soft reboot tests from the server_actions

These test case are skipped since long,
we are testing the soft reboot in the basic minimal scenario.

Change-Id: Ic3c7128a20b74d2c518c9514aa59153de951ff07
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/51/74351/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from tempest.test import skip_because @skip_because(bug="1014647") @attr(type='smoke') def test_reboot_server_soft(self): # The server should be signaled to reboot gracefully if self.run_ssh: # Get the time the server was last rebooted, resp, server = self.client.get_server(self.server_id) linux_client = RemoteClient(server, self.ssh_user, self.password) boot_time = linux_client.get_boot_time() resp, body = self.client.reboot(self.server_id, 'SOFT') self.assertEqual(202, resp.status) self.client.wait_for_server_status(self.server_id, 'ACTIVE') if self.run_ssh: # Log in and verify the boot time has changed linux_client = RemoteClient(server, self.ssh_user, self.password) new_boot_time = linux_client.get_boot_time() self.assertGreater(new_boot_time, boot_time)

subject: Remove cliff-tablib from test-requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-05 14:12:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/a7610250626539c01ef3d05e748122084b1b50ff', 'message': "Remove cliff-tablib from test-requirements

Reason:
- code of cliff-tablib is out of date, one year ago.
- it depends on tablib which is out of date too, two years ago.
- tablib's latest release has a critical problem on python 3.3, which
  prevents us to install dependent package before run unit test.
- there are only two unit test methods depend on cliff-tablib.

This patch removes the cliff-tablib and fixes the corresponding problem
to support py33 unit test.

Implements: blueprint py33-support
Change-Id: If085f64c573f4b9f004962e3c0d90c451f93263e
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-07 07:09:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/b4f8dcd8a67d99f0e9f6427f4d40414f8ff6fe77', 'message': "Remove cliff-tablib from test-requirements

Reason:
- code of cliff-tablib is out of date, one year ago.
- it depends on tablib which is out of date too, two years ago.
- tablib's latest release has a critical problem on python 3.3, which
  prevents us to install dependent package before run unit test.
- there are only two unit test methods depend on cliff-tablib.

This patch removes the cliff-tablib and fixes the corresponding problem
to support py33 unit test.

Implements: blueprint py33-support
Change-Id: If085f64c573f4b9f004962e3c0d90c451f93263e
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-27 03:58:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20_network.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/6be6e67360741f6ddc5a55ab35952ed2884b03e8', 'message': "Remove cliff-tablib from test-requirements

cliff-tablib is needed only in test-requirements.txt but current unit
test code doesn't need it widely. If we keep it on the list of
test-requirements.txt, it only blocks the py33 virtual enviroment setup,
which is caused by the out-dated tablib module doesn't support python 3.

This patch removes the cliff-tablib and fixes the corresponding problem
of '-f json' to support py33 unit test, note that '-f json' needs
cliff-tablib for json formatter support, and this is the only part
cliff-tablib is needed.

Note that this patch only aims at enabling py33 virtual environment
setup, there are still lots of import errors block py33 unit test, which

commit_message:
Remove cliff-tablib from test-requirements

cliff-tablib is needed only in test-requirements.txt but current unit
test code doesn't need it widely. If we keep it on the list of
test-requirements.txt, it only blocks the py33 virtual enviroment setup,
which is caused by the out-dated tablib module doesn't support python 3.

This patch removes the cliff-tablib and fixes the corresponding problem
of '-f json' to support py33 unit test, note that '-f json' needs
cliff-tablib for json formatter support, and this is the only part
cliff-tablib is needed.

Note that this patch only aims at enabling py33 virtual environment
setup, there are still lots of import errors block py33 unit test, which
will be fixed in other patches.

Implements: blueprint py33-support
Change-Id: If085f64c573f4b9f004962e3c0d90c451f93263e

commit_message:
Change the scope of update's policy to compute:v3:servers:update v3

For distinguishing core and extension api. core api will use
'compute:v3' as the scope of policy. This patch change it for
server's update.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I3ac3d05490f0545f243e2db1da5e039a04e18ff3

commit_message:
Move policy check of reboot to api layer

This patch moves "compute:reboot" to api layer for ec2 and nova
api v2, and uses "compute:v3:servers:reboot" for nova api v3.
Also removes policy check from compute api. And give default rules
for v3 policy check.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I3a828b243cec4ab9f5bfe352abd5ccfb54b4a65a

commit_message:
Move policy check of shelve/unshelve/shelve_offload to api layer

This patch moves "compute:shelve/unshelve/shelve_offload" to api layer
nova api v2, and uses "compute_extension:v3:os-shelve:shelve/unshelve/shelve_offload"
for nova api v3. Also removes policy check from compute api. Also add
related tests and fix the wrong tests in test_shelve.py
eg: test_shelve_allowed shouldn't raise the exception.NotAuthorized.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I486f5ad02ff508fbb77fbabdd6ba2dd850d4ec0f

commit_message:
Remove db layer policy checks for migration

This patch removes policy checks in db layer for migration,
and related unittest.

Also remove elevated context when invoke migration db, that needless
anymore.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

UpgradeImpact: There is no longer a secondary check in the db layer
and the policy specified for "compute_extension:migrations:index" is the
only restriction for v2 api. If the policy has changed to empty, it need
update to "compute_extension:migrations:index": "rule:admin_api" at aleast.

Change-Id: I64ae3823a151f3ae32cfa614cefc29cf4abfa4a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/73132/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove db layer authorization for certificates

This patches remove db layer authorization for certificates.
For v2 api, the default policy rule is empty, so add admin
authorization in v2 api layer for keep default behavior.

For v3 api, use policy rule to ensure the request is admin.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact
UpgradeImpact: There is no longer a secondary check in the db layer
and the policy specified for compute_extension:certificates is the
only restriction. The default policy rule need update to:
"compute_extension:certificates": "rule:admin_api"

Change-Id: I014d2d5562bcf097168a2502a20c602b64c033d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/76/73176/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Move policy checks of resize/revert_resize/confirm_resize into api

This patch removes policy checks "compute:resize/revert_resize/confirm-resize"
from compute api. And move those into api layer for v2 api.

commit_message:
Move policy check of pci to api layer

This patch moves the policy to api layer, gives default rules for v3
policy check. Adds "compute_extension:v3:os-pci:pci_hypervisors" for pci V3.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I67e1f4645f5ae915fce68119e9fc405f8712dea9

commit_message:
Remove db layer authorize for keypair

In db layer, keypair will authorize the user id. But the user id
is aways same with request context's user id. So this authorize
didn't have any effect. This patch just removes those authorize.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: Id19c7d1b325e1f530c51b6473c5cbdbe062baf9d

deleted_lines: @require_context@require_context def key_pair_destroy(context, user_id, name): nova.context.authorize_user_context(context, user_id)@require_context def key_pair_get(context, user_id, name): nova.context.authorize_user_context(context, user_id)@require_context def key_pair_get_all_by_user(context, user_id): nova.context.authorize_user_context(context, user_id) nova.context.authorize_user_context(context, user_id)

commit_message:
Move policy check of get_all into api layer

This patch moves "compute:get_all" to api layer for ec2 and nova
api v2, and uses "compute:v3:servers:index/detail" for nova api v3.
Also removes policy check from compute api. And give default rules
for v3 policy check.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I2742d77fd856336140fe3c604425b9f9f74f7df5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/73547/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.api.openstack import extensions extensions.check_compute_policy(context, 'get_all', {'project_id': context.project_id, 'user_id': context.user_id})

commit_message:
Move policy check of rescue/unrescue to api layer

This patch moves "compute:rescue/unrescue" to api layer nova
api v2, and uses "compute_extensions:v3:os-rescue:rescue/unrescue"
for nova api v3. Also removes policy check from compute api. And
give default rules for v3 policy check.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I34afcbb0d27ff1b430253ed93468a6c4bf59a3f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/64997/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.openstack.common import policy as common_policy def test_rescue_policy_failed(self): rules = { "compute:rescue": common_policy.parse_rule("project_id:non_fake"), "compute_extension:rescue": common_policy.parse_rule("@"), } common_policy.set_rules(common_policy.Rules(rules)) req = webob.Request.blank('/v2/fake/servers/test_inst/action') req.method = "POST" req.headers["content-type"] = "application/json" req.body = jsonutils.dumps({"rescue": ""}) resp = req.get_response(self.app) self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 403) self.assertIn("compute:rescue", resp.body) def test_unrescue_policy_failed(self): rules = { "compute:unrescue": common_policy.parse_rule("project_id:non_fake"), "compute_extension:rescue": common_policy.parse_rule("@"), } common_policy.set_rules(common_policy.Rules(rules)) req = webob.Request.blank('/v2/fake/servers/test_inst/action') req.method = "POST" req.headers["content-type"] = "application/json" req.body = jsonutils.dumps({"unrescue": ""}) resp = req.get_response(self.app) self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 403) self.assertIn("compute:unrescue", resp.body)

commit_message:
Move quota-sets db layer policy checks into api layer

This patch removes db layer policy checks for quota-sets. For v3
api, add policy scope "compute_extension:v3:os-quota-sets:user_quota"
for user quota. For v2 api, it just keep compatibility.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

UpgradeImpact: There is no longer a secondary check in the db layer
and the policy specified for compute_extension:quotas/update/delete
is the only restriction for v2 api. If the default policy rule has
changed, it need update to:
"compute_extension:update/delete": "rule:admin_api"

Change-Id: Id14d13f20556f74004a9971ee66b6ac204ca4623

commit_message:
Move policy check of delete to api layer

This patch moves "compute:delete" to api layer for ec2 and nova
api v2, and uses "compute:v3:servers:delete" for nova api v3.
Also removes policy check from compute api. And give default rules
for v3 policy check.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib9a8bd7e7fc478a26a2b488f64b8276e95a528fe

commit_message:
Not use legacy block device mapping when rebuild

Currently when rebuild instance, the bdms are created with
legacy format and cause issue for re-attach the bdm.

Change it to not use legacy block device mapping.

Closes-bug: 1278533

Change-Id: Ic96419a1bd8e66317cdf34701996a0650f6c7c62
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import sqlalchemy as sa import datetime from marconi.queues.storage import errors from marconi.queues.storage.sqlalchemy import tables from marconi.queues.storage.sqlalchemy import utils class ClaimController(storage.Claim): def __get(self, cid): sel = sa.sql.select([tables.Messages.c.id, tables.Messages.c.content, tables.Messages.c.ttl, tables.Messages.c.created], sa._and( tables.Messages.c.ttl> utils.get_age(tables.Claims.c.created), tables.Messages.c.cid==cid ), from_obj=[tables.Messages.join(tables.Locked)]) records = self.driver.run(sel) for id, content, ttl, created in records: ageSec = utils.get_age(created) yield { 'id': utils.msgid_encode(id), 'ttl': ttl, 'age': int(ageSec), 'body': content, } def get(self, queue, claim_id, project=None): if project is None: project = '' cid = utils.cid_decode(claim_id) if cid is None: raise errors.ClaimDoesNotExist(claim_id, queue, project) with self.driver.trans() as trans: sel = sa.sql.select([tables.Claims.c.id, tables.Claims.c.ttl, tables.Claims.c.created], sa._and(tables.Claims.c.ttl> utils.get_age(tables.Claims.c.created), tables.Claims.c.id==cid, tables.Claims.c.project==project, tables.Claims.c.name==queue), from_obj=[tables.Queues.join(tables.Claims)]) res = trans.execute(sel).fetchone() if res is None: raise errors.ClaimDoesNotExist(claim_id, queue, project) else: res.close() id, ttl, created = res age = utils.get_age(created) return ( { 'id': claim_id, 'ttl': ttl, 'age': int(age), }, self.__get(id) ) def create(self, queue, metadata, project=None, limit=DEFAULT_MESSAGES_PER_CLAIM): if project is None: project = '' with self.driver.trans() as trans: try: qid = utils.get_qid(self.driver, queue, project) except errors.QueueDoesNotExist: return None, iter([]) # Clean up all expired claims in this queue dlt = tables.Claims.delete().where(sa.and_( tables.Claims.c.ttl<= utils.get_age(tables.Claims.c.created), tables.Claims.c.qid==qid)) trans.execute(dlt) ins = tables.Claims.insert().values(id=None, qid=qid, ttl=metadata['ttl'], created=datetime.datetime.now()) res = trans.execute(ins) id = res.inserted_primary_key sel = sa.sql.select([tables.Messages.c.id], sa._and(tables.Messages.c.id==None, tables.Messages.c.ttl> utils.get_age(tables.Messages.c.created), tables.Messages.c.qid==qid ), from_obj=[tables.Messages.outerjoin( tables.Locked)]).limit(limit) records = trans.execute(sel) ins = tables.Locked.insert().values(records.fetchall()) res = trans.execute(ins) messages_ttl = metadata['ttl'] + metadata['grace'] self.__update_claimed(id, messages_ttl) return (utils.cid_encode(id), self.__get(id)) def update(self, queue, claim_id, metadata, project=None): if project is None: project = '' id = utils.cid_decode(claim_id) if id is None: raise errors.ClaimDoesNotExist(claim_id, queue, project) age = utils.get_age(tables.Claims.c.created) with self.driver.trans() as trans: qid = utils.get_qid(self.driver, queue, project) update = tables.Claims.update().\ where(and_( tables.Claims.c.ttl>age, tables.Claims.c.id==id, tables.Claims.c.id==qid)).\ values(created=datetime.datetime.now(), ttl=metadata['ttl']) trans.execute(update) if res.rowcount != 1: raise errors.ClaimDoesNotExist(claim_id, queue, project) self.__update_claimed(id, metadata['ttl']) def __update_claimed(self, cid, ttl): # Precondition: cid is not expired sel = sa.sql.select([tables.Locked.c.msgid], tables.Locked.c.cid==cid) records = self.driver.run(sel) update = tables.Messages.update().\ where(and_( tables.Messages.c.ttl<ttl, tables.Messages.c.id in records)).\ values(created=datetime.datetime.now(), ttl=metadata['ttl']) self.driver.run(update) def delete(self, queue, claim_id, project=None): if project is None: project = '' cid = utils.cid_decode(claim_id) if cid is None: return qid = utils.get_qid(self.driver, queue, project) dlt = tables.Claims.delete().where(sa._and(tables.Claims.c.id==cid, tables.Claims.c.qid==qid )) self.driver.run(dlt)

commit_message:
Rename Service.compute_node to compute_nodes

There can be more than 1 compute_node for a service, each for a
different 'node'. This needs to work properly for the resource tracker.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: Ib37fbf3e444b5303c33a1589536306753434ff6f

commit_message:
Adds a new filter to implement project isolation feature

If an aggregate contains 'project_to_aggregate' as a metadata key,
then instances for those specified projects can only be created on hosts
which are part of that aggregate.
If a project is not attached to any specific aggregate, it is free to
create instances on any hosts.

Implements: blueprint projects-to-aggregate filter
Reference Link : https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/projects-to-aggregate

Change-Id: I8bbcc3aa35b9a16fac8e3beeb4c8f61364272555
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/83/73283/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @require_admin_context def aggregate_metadata_get_all_by_key(context, key=None): query = model_query(context, models.Aggregate).join("_metadata") if key: query = query.filter(models.AggregateMetadata.key == key) rows = query.all() metadata = collections.defaultdict(set) for aggr in rows: for kv in aggr._metadata: if not key or kv['key'] == key: metadata[kv['key']].add(kv['value']) return metadata @require_admin_context

Remove limitation to 12.04 release because the problematic
11.10 release is no longer supported and all the later releases
need cmd2.

commit_message:
Remove dependent module py3kcompat

Module py3kcompat was removed from oslo-incubator, so savanna
should sync the olso.

+sync db.sqlalchemy module from oslo-incubator
+use six directly replace py3kcompat

Change-Id: I2f2c7a115a20bdf032bd3539a591e6a593250f4e
Closes-Bug: #1280033

commit_message:
Moving rest to Pecan/WSME framework

/v1.0 and /v1.1 endpoints are serverd as /v1.1 now
/v1 endpoint added for simplicity and is served as /v1.1

Config entry to disable v1 api added

New v2 endpoints:
Get /v2/plugins/
Get /v2/plugins/vanilla/1.2.1

Post /v2/images/register

Partially implements bp v2-api-pecan-framework
Change-Id: Ibaf1e1b5015d5bdd89084bd1a5a18d48572c609b

added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Copyright (c) 2013 Mirantis Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import gettext import os import sys from wsgiref import simple_server import pecan from oslo.config import cfg from savanna.plugins import base as plugins_base from savanna.service import api as service_api from savanna.api.v2 import config as api_config from savanna.utils import remote # If ../savanna/__init__.py exists, add ../ to Python search path, so that # it will override what happens to be installed in /usr/(local/)lib/python... possible_topdir = os.path.normpath(os.path.join(os.path.abspath(sys.argv[0]), os.pardir, os.pardir)) if os.path.exists(os.path.join(possible_topdir, 'savanna', '__init__.py')): sys.path.insert(0, possible_topdir) gettext.install('savanna', unicode=1) from savanna import config from savanna.db import api as db_api import savanna.main as server from savanna.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def main(): dev_conf = os.path.join(possible_topdir, 'etc', 'savanna', 'savanna.conf') config_files = None if os.path.exists(dev_conf): config_files = [dev_conf] config.parse_configs(sys.argv[1:], config_files) logging.setup("savanna") if not db_api.setup_db(): raise RuntimeError('Failed to create database!') db_api.setup_db() plugins_base.setup_plugins() engine = server._get_infrastructure_engine() remote.setup_remote(engine) service_api.setup_service_api(engine) pecan_config_file = api_config.__file__.replace('.pyc', '.py') pecan_config = pecan.configuration.conf_from_file(pecan_config_file) root = pecan.make_app(pecan_config.app.root, debug=cfg.CONF.debug, force_canonical=getattr(pecan_config.app, 'force_canonical', True), guess_content_type_from_ext=False) srv = simple_server.make_server(cfg.CONF.host, cfg.CONF.port, root) srv.serve_forever()

commit_message:
introduce apache:vhost::wsgi class

This patch introduce the use of apache::vhost instead of
Apache configuration file produced from template.

This methods has two advantages:
- apache class stops thinking its files have been changed and do not
  trigger a full reload of the httpd service
- the ability to maintain different vhost on the same apache
- simplicity, espcially regarding SSL

It also avoid the use of 0.0.0.0 as bind IP since it prevents the
use of IPv6.

This patch doesn't fix any blocker bugs and introduces a lot of experimental
changes that will raise questions. The patch will probably be refactored.
I39b52b2bc51ba04d59de81dc45b5a4ad82d0dc2c is similar but already have
a consensus and fix a bug .
That's the reason why I prefer to not merge them but only to depend on the
first one.

Change-Id: Ie4f516270cb99144e1b930097cd5b1207f287626

commit_message:
Add use_syslog to Marconi config

This patch adds use_syslog option to the marconi config file. This
is needed to allow marconi to run, when USE_SCREEN is set to False
in devstack.

Change-Id: I547697ec2745975e235a4e58cde81132ac37b70d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/46/77246/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $MARCONI_CONF DEFAULT use_syslog $SYSLOG

commit_message:
Added rule body reordering for safety

Previously, we assumed the user would order rule bodies to ensure
that negative literals always occurred after all their vars were
bound.

This change moves all the negative literals to the end of each rule.
It is not even smart enough to check whether there is a need to
change the ordering.  Will need to be revised once performance becomes
an issue.

Change-Id: Idae20e23abc70307fcfba5d11b1a5958d4ab05bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/19/76019/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

""" # ensure negatives come after positives positives = [lit for lit in delta.body if not lit.is_negated()] negatives = [lit for lit in delta.body if lit.is_negated()] positives.extend(negatives) delta.body = positives DeltaRuleTheory.reorder(rule)

commit_message:
Write DO_NOT_UPGRADE_SERVICES to grenade's localrc not devstacks

This should fix check-grenade-dsvm-partial-ncpu which currently isn't
getting DO_NOT_UPGRADE_SERVICES=[n-cpu] written to its localrc file

Change-Id: Ided01c2688c360881e99c794b518021cd0c302c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/58/76658/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cat <<EOF >>$BASE/new/grenade/localrc

subject: Support authentication via SAML 2.0 assertions

with keystone, provided the incoming assertion is valid.

The file keystone/contrib/federation/controllers.py was extended with two
new controllers.V3Controller classes:

*) DomainV3 which handles /v3/OS-FEDERATION/domains API call and returns
   list of domains a user can access based on the provided list of groups.

*) ProjectV3 which handles /v3/OS-FEDERATION/projects API call and returns
   list of project a user can access based on the provided list of groups.

commit_message:
Support authentication via SAML 2.0 assertions

This patch will support authentication via SAML 2.0 assertions.
A new authentication plugin will allow external users to authenticate
with keystone, provided the incoming assertion is valid.

The file keystone/contrib/federation/controllers.py was extended with two
new controllers.V3Controller classes:

*) DomainV3 which handles /v3/OS-FEDERATION/domains API call and returns
   list of domains a user can access based on the provided list of groups.

*) ProjectV3 which handles /v3/OS-FEDERATION/projects API call and returns
   list of project a user can access based on the provided list of groups.

Change-Id: I89f70e3a24e825e21580772c088c6fd5c44f3b63
Implements: blueprint saml-id
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/53/71353/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # SAML consuming helpful methods def get_mapping_from_idp_proto(self, idp_id, proto_id): session = db_session.get_session() with session.begin(): protocol_ref = self._get_protocol(idp_id, proto_id) mapping_id = protocol_ref.mapping_id mapping_ref = self._get_mapping(session, mapping_id) return mapping_ref.to_dict()

testing, Jasmine could be a good choices because of its great features
and it is the one which is described into angularjs documentation. It
will allow us to have good example for creating our tests.

    This commit contains a rewriting of horizon.messages.js testing,
an helper for quick test writing, and an html base template for
jasmine testing.

    To create a test you just have to inherit JasmineTests class, and
specify the tests files to run (with their path) in the specs class
attribute. If some html elements are needed, just inherit from the
jasmine.html template and add them to the content block, to finish
specify the template in the test class into the template_name attribute.

commit_message:
Add jasmine testing and helpers

    With the integration of the AngularJS framework we need a powerfull
testing, Jasmine could be a good choices because of its great features
and it is the one which is described into angularjs documentation. It
will allow us to have good example for creating our tests.

    To create a test you just have to inherit JasmineTests class, and
specify the tests files to run (with their path) in the specs class
attribute. If some html elements are needed, just inherit from the
jasmine.html template and add them to the content block, to finish
specify the template in the test class into the template_name attribute.

Implements: blueprint jasmine-integration
Change-Id: Ic39d3a4f097de045d1c789052ff4e43eb0ebde7e

subject: Proper fix for test_run_scenario_exception_inside_test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-01 01:53:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/8a2cfc602d0284511fdb4e0e3dbea73f7ecafdfa', 'message': 'Proper fix for test_run_scenario_exception_inside_test

We were getting non deterministic bugs in this method. But adding
more time like here  I1007436736bf9d42b98c8782a6141203c271aa75 is
not a proper way.

commit_message:
Proper fix for test_run_scenario_exception_inside_test

We were getting non deterministic bugs in this method. But adding
more time like here  I1007436736bf9d42b98c8782a6141203c271aa75 is
not a proper way.

If we change order of check duration & running method we will be able
to run it exactly one time, even if we set duration == 0.

So it will raise exception => we will be able to check that is raised.

Change-Id: I64964f8386a06f0a54e134d62a59e0955e3a8d75
Closes-bug: #1283372

added_lines: @mock.patch("rally.benchmark.runner.rutils") def test_run_scenario_times_exception_inside_test(self, mock_osclients, mock_utils): mock_utils.Timer = fakes.FakeTimer srunner = continuous.ContinuousScenarioRunner(mock.MagicMock(), self.fake_endpoints) times = 1 active_users = 2 results = srunner._run_scenario(fakes.FakeScenario, "something_went_wrong", {}, {"times": times, "timeout": 1, "active_users": active_users}) self.assertEqual(len(results), times) for r in results: self.assertEqual(r['time'], 10) self.assertEqual(r['error'][:2], [str(Exception), "Something went wrong"]) @mock.patch("rally.benchmark.runner.rutils") @mock.patch("rally.benchmark.utils.osclients") def test_run_scenario_duration_exception_inside_test(self, mock_osclients, mock_utils): mock_osclients.Clients.return_value = fakes.FakeClients() mock_utils.Timer = fakes.FakeTimer srunner = continuous.ContinuousScenarioRunner(mock.MagicMock(), self.fake_endpoints) srunner.users = _get_fake_users(5) active_users = 2 results = srunner._run_scenario(fakes.FakeScenario, "something_went_wrong", {}, {"duration": 0, "timeout": 1, "active_users": active_users}) for r in results: self.assertEqual(r['time'], 10) self.assertEqual(r['error'][:2], [str(Exception), "Something went wrong"])

commit_message:
Remove trailing comma from sample JSON

The json sample configuration file contains a trailing comma on
some elements. This is a syntax error, this change corrects the
problem.

Change-Id: I5e79f4a09e93e458acfe7000f2e5703548f965e6
Closes-bug: #1283718

commit_message:
Add provision_updated_at to node's resource

This patch is a follow up of e7c4e1882b0bee2a984db7e24e8bd52d008b984b,
it's adding the new provision_updated_at field to the node's resource
body so that it can be retrieved by GET request.

Change-Id: I2091e8de6d9d3df3299358a254aa67e846ccfb47

subject: Add pack_action_start/finish helper to InstanceAction object
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-16 15:40:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/004f6d55ee4797f022daabe3bb405c58ed47d7ed', 'message': 'Refactor start/finish method for InstanceAction object model

Current InstanceAction object model is mixed with usage of both class
and object methods for action start or finish. This change unified
InstanceAction object model to always use object method for updating.

Besides that, this model still requires packing and db access for both
start and finish call, which is expected to be further optimized in
blueprint of improve-instance-action-events.

Other details of this change:
* Add pack_action_start/finish method for InstanceAction object model
* Remove action_start/finish class method
* Rewrite InstanceAction unit test using mock
* Adjust InstanceAction usage in compute/api.py accordingly

This is a part of: blueprint make-instance-action-use-objects

Change-Id: I38bde7b057efa0ce5634941f4ffa5ef27123958c

commit_message:
Add pack_action_start/finish helper to InstanceAction object

Add these two helper function to cut InstanceAction object's dependency
on compute/utils.py. This is a refactor change so that
pack_action_start/finish code in compute/utils.py can be removed in a
later change.

The version of InstanceAction object doesn't change, since it's just an
object internal refactoring. No object field or method has been changed.

This is a part of: blueprint make-instance-action-use-objects

Change-Id: I38bde7b057efa0ce5634941f4ffa5ef27123958c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/04/62404/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.openstack.common import timeutils # Version 1.2: Replace action_start/action_finish class method with # start/finish method for InstanceAction object VERSION = '1.2' @staticmethod def pack_action_start(context, action, instance_uuid, action_name): action.request_id = context.request_id action.user_id = context.user_id action.project_id = context.project_id action.instance_uuid = instance_uuid action.action = action_name action.start_time = context.timestamp @staticmethod def pack_action_finish(context, action, instance_uuid): action.request_id = context.request_id action.instance_uuid = instance_uuid action.finish_time = timeutils.utcnow() @base.remotable def start(self, context): updates = self.obj_get_changes() db_action = db.action_start(context, updates) return self._from_db_object(context, self, db_action) updates = self.obj_get_changes() db_action = db.action_finish(context, updates) return self._from_db_object(context, self, db_action)
deleted_lines: VERSION = '1.1' # NOTE(danms): Eventually the compute_utils.*action* methods # can be here, I think @base.remotable_classmethod def action_start(cls, context, instance_uuid, action_name, want_result=True): values = compute_utils.pack_action_start(context, instance_uuid, action_name) db_action = db.action_start(context, values) if want_result: return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), db_action) @base.remotable_classmethod def action_finish(cls, context, instance_uuid, want_result=True): values = compute_utils.pack_action_finish(context, instance_uuid) db_action = db.action_finish(context, values) if want_result: return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), db_action) values = compute_utils.pack_action_finish(context, self.instance_uuid) db_action = db.action_finish(context, values) self._from_db_object(context, self, db_action)

subject: Ensure ovsdb-client is stopped when OVS agent dies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-19 22:47:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e10f662227429e98347f8eab54e90a485276bd34', 'message': 'Ensure ovsdb-client is stopped when OVS agent dies

If the OVS agent is killed, the interpreter is killed before any cleanup
is done. This patch adds a signal handler for SIGTERM that exits

commit_message:
Ensure ovsdb-client is stopped when OVS agent dies

If the OVS agent is killed, the interpreter is killed before any cleanup
is done. This patch adds a signal handler for SIGTERM that exits
normally so that the existing cleanup is done and the ovsdb-client
process is terminated.

Change-Id: Ie4f8ff434098100f4699124403d58caa784084cf

commit_message:
Prevent a node in maintenance from being deployed

Prevent a node which is in maintenance mode from being deployed, other
operations like enabling/disabling the console and changing the power
state of the node should still be allowed.

Change-Id: I3b0139638816d1cbf909516b4e584f92bc89e88b

commit_message:
Add tests for Swift in orchestration

Change-Id: I5102768103a1d2f772afba9c94316ba44b32f198
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/58/65358/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright (C) 2013 eNovance SAS <licensing@enovance.com> # # Author: Chmouel Boudjnah <chmouel@enovance.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging from tempest.api.orchestration import base from tempest import clients from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.test import attr LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class SwiftResourcesTestJSON(base.BaseOrchestrationTest): _interface = 'json' template = """ heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 description: Template which creates a Swift container ressource resources: SwiftContainerWebsite: DeletionPolicy: "Delete" Type: OS::Swift::Container Properties: X-Container-Read: ".r:*" X-Container-Meta: web-index: "index.html" web-error: "error.html" SwiftContainer: Type: OS::Swift::Container outputs: WebsiteURL: description: "URL for website hosted on S3" value: { get_attr: [SwiftContainer, WebsiteURL] } DomainName: description: "Domain of Swift host" value: { get_attr: [SwiftContainer, DomainName] } """ @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(SwiftResourcesTestJSON, cls).setUpClass() cls.client = cls.orchestration_client cls.stack_name = data_utils.rand_name('heat') os = clients.Manager() if not os.config.service_available.swift: raise cls.skipException("Neutron support is required") cls.account_client = os.account_client cls.container_client = os.container_client # create the stack cls.stack_identifier = cls.create_stack( cls.stack_name, cls.template) cls.stack_id = cls.stack_identifier.split('/')[1] cls.client.wait_for_stack_status(cls.stack_id, 'CREATE_COMPLETE') cls.test_resources = {} _, resources = cls.client.list_resources(cls.stack_identifier) for resource in resources: cls.test_resources[resource['logical_resource_id']] = resource @attr(type='slow') def test_created_resources(self): """Created stack should be on the list of existing stacks.""" resources = [('SwiftContainer', 'OS::Swift::Container'), ('SwiftContainerWebsite', 'OS::Swift::Container')] for resource_name, resource_type in resources: resource = self.test_resources.get(resource_name, None) self.assertIsInstance(resource, dict) self.assertEqual(resource_type, resource['resource_type']) self.assertEqual(resource_name, resource['logical_resource_id']) self.assertEqual('CREATE_COMPLETE', resource['resource_status']) def test_created_containers(self): params = {'format': 'json'} resp, container_list = \ self.account_client.list_account_containers(params=params) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) self.assertEqual(len(container_list), 2) for cont in container_list: self.assertTrue(cont['name'].startswith(self.stack_name)) def test_acl(self): acl_headers = ('x-container-meta-web-index', 'x-container-read') swcont = self.test_resources.get( 'SwiftContainer')['physical_resource_id'] swcont_website = self.test_resources.get( 'SwiftContainerWebsite')['physical_resource_id'] headers, _ = self.container_client.list_container_metadata(swcont) for h in acl_headers: self.assertNotIn(h, headers) headers, _ = self.container_client.list_container_metadata( swcont_website) for h in acl_headers: self.assertIn(h, headers) def test_metadata(self): metadatas = { "web-index": "index.html", "web-error": "error.html" } swcont_website = self.test_resources.get( 'SwiftContainerWebsite')['physical_resource_id'] headers, _ = self.container_client.list_container_metadata( swcont_website) for meta in metadatas: header_meta = "x-container-meta-%s" % meta self.assertIn(header_meta, headers) self.assertEqual(headers[header_meta], metadatas[meta])

commit_message:
Allow clients to mark a node as in maintenance

Before the maintenance attribute was treated as an internal one, but it's
not, users should be able to mark a node as in maintenance. So this patch
is removing the maintenance attribute from the internal attributes list.

Change-Id: I35cbca53b7a0c253d2880bb7d350f70d5b4103a4

commit_message:
Add option to sync node power state from DB

Previously, during _sync_node_power_state, when a node's power state did
not match the expected state, the DB was always updated and a warning
logged.

This patch causes the node's power state to instead be set to the
expected value, by default, and adds a CONF option to enable the old
behavior.

Implements bp:keep-powered-off-nodes-off

Co-Authored-By: Michael Davies <michael@the-davies.net>
Change-Id: I1f5af0061dbe8c57b8bd3f8a65b215aadd549551
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/93/76293/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # During sync_power_state, should the hardware power state be # set to the expected state (True) or should the database be # updated based on the hardware state (False). Default: True. # (boolean value) #force_power_state_during_sync=true

commit_message:
Use pretty tox with the ``all`` env

The all entry is usable for running custom set of test
cases selected by a regexp in similar venv
as the gate uses with tox -eall.

The pretty tox helps you to see some basic results before,
 the test suite finished.

Change-Id: I553e450ad0a59308be0bfa24aa66877cdb6667da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/51/75351/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:custom] commands = bash tools/pretty_tox.sh '{posargs}'

subject: Fix in in novaclient, to avoid excessive conns
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-20 21:58:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/3ac2604d6e16de8e91dbc629166d2dfafc465690', 'message': "Fix in in novaclient, to avoid excessive conns

The current client creates new .Session() on each request,
but since Horizon is a stateless app, each Session creates
new HttpAdapter, which itself has its own connection pool,
and each connection there is used (almost) once and then
is being kept in the pool(with Keep-Alive) for a certain
amount of time(waiting for inactivity timeout). The problem
is that the connection cannot be used anymore from next Django
calls - they create new connection pool with new connections, etc.
This keeps lots of open connections on the server.

Now the client will store an HTTPAdapter for each URL into
a singleton object, and will reuse its connections between
Django calls, but still taking advantage of Sessions during
a single page load(although we do not fully use this).

Note: the default pool behavior is non-blocking, which means
that if the max_pool_size is reached, a new connection will
still be opened, and when released - will be discarded.
It could be useful to add max_pool_size param into settings,
for performance fine-tuning. The default max_pool_size is 10.

Since python-novaclient is also used from non-Django projects,
I'd expect feedback from more people on the impact this change
could have over other projects.

Change-Id: Icc9dc2fa2863d0e0e26a86c8180f2e0fbcd1fcff
Closes-Bug: #1247056

commit_message:
Fix in in novaclient, to avoid excessive conns

The current client creates new .Session() on each request,
but since Horizon is a stateless app, each Session creates
new HttpAdapter, which itself has its own connection pool,
and each connection there is used (almost) once and then
is being kept in the pool(with Keep-Alive) for a certain
amount of time(waiting for inactivity timeout). The problem
is that the connection cannot be used anymore from next Django
calls - they create new connection pool with new connections, etc.
This keeps lots of open connections on the server.

Now the client will store an HTTPAdapter for each URL into
a singleton object, and will reuse its connections between
Django calls, but still taking advantage of Sessions during
a single page load(although we do not fully use this).

Note: the default pool behavior is non-blocking, which means
that if the max_pool_size is reached, a new connection will
still be opened, and when released - will be discarded.
It could be useful to add max_pool_size param into settings,
for performance fine-tuning. The default max_pool_size is 10.

Since python-novaclient is also used from non-Django projects,
I'd expect feedback from more people on the impact this change
could have over other projects.

Patch Set 3: Removed explicit connection closing, leaving
connections open in the pool.

Change-Id: Icc9dc2fa2863d0e0e26a86c8180f2e0fbcd1fcff
Closes-Bug: #1247056
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/96/75196/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from requests.adapters import HTTPAdapter def singleton(cls): instances = {} def getinstance(): if cls not in instances: instances[cls] = cls() return instances[cls] return getinstance @singleton class AdapterPool(object): """ Singleton containing adapters with connection pools per URL """ def __init__(self): self.url_map = {} def get_adapter(self, url): if url not in self.url_map: self.url_map[url] = HTTPAdapter() return self.url_map[url] class HTTPClient(object): self._current_url = None def __del__(self): if hasattr(self, '_http'): # close and release all open connections from requests.Session() self._http.close() def http(self, url): if self._current_url != url: # Invalidate Session object in case the url is somehow changed if hasattr(self, '_http'): self._http.close() self._http = None self._current_url = url self._logger.debug("New session created for: (%s)" % url) self._http = requests.Session() magic_tuple = urlutils.urlsplit(url) scheme, netloc, path, query, frag = magic_tuple service_url = '%s://%s' % (scheme, netloc) self._http.mount(service_url, AdapterPool().get_adapter(service_url)) return self._http resp = self.http(url).request( # To ensure the current HttpConnection will be released to the pool, # the resp.content property should be consumed. # http://requests.readthedocs.org/en/latest/user/advanced/#keep-alive resp.content
